These advancements have made communication more efficient and have introduced new complexities in terms of data management, connectivity, and information overload.

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Environmental communication includes human representation of nature.Statement II:For the purpose of promoting environmental communication, only mainstream conventional media should be employed.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect

Statement I: It is correct. The field of environmental communication involves the study of existing communication about environmental issues and the identification of methods for improved communication about environmental issues. Environmental communication involves various forms of communication aimed at raising awareness, promoting understanding, and encouraging action on environmental issues. This includes conveying scientific information, advocating for policy changes, engaging with stakeholders, and more.

Statement II: It is incorrect to suggest that only mainstream conventional media should be employed for promoting environmental communication. Environmental communication strategies often utilize a diverse range of media channels and platforms, including social media, community radio, documentaries, grassroots campaigns, and educational programs. Employing a variety of media allows for reaching different audiences and addressing diverse environmental issues effectively.

Question 21
Certain books are bought at prices ranging from ₹ 400 to ₹ 500 per book and are sold at prices ranging from ₹ 500 to ₹ 700 per book. Find the greatest possible profit that might be made in selling 10 books. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.₹ 4000
  • B.₹ 3000
  • C.₹ 3800
  • D.₹ 7000
Correct Answer: ₹ 3000

The profit will be maximum when the books are bought at lowest price and sold at maximum price.

Thus CP for 10 books = 400 × 10 = Rs. 4000

SP for 10 books = 700 × 10 = Rs. 7000

Profit = 7000 – 4000 = Rs. 3000

Question 22
A woman, while introducing a man, says "His wife is the only daughter of my father". How is that man related to the woman? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Father-in-law
  • B.Brother-in-law
  • C.Husband
  • D.Brother
Correct Answer: Husband

Option C is correct.

"His wife" refers to the wife of the man being introduced.

"is the only daughter of my father" indicates that the wife of the man being introduced is the only daughter of the woman's father.

If the wife of the man is the only daughter of the woman's father, then the man being introduced is the husband of the woman. Therefore, the man is related to the woman as her husband.

Question 23
Find the number that can replace question mark (?) in the series given below. 1, 3, 2, 5, 3, 7, 4, 9, 5, 11, 6, 13, ?(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.15
  • B.7
  • C.19
  • D.8
Correct Answer: 7

Next number = 6 + 1 = 7

Question 24
In a certain code:(a) '3245' means 'you must study hard'(b) '567’ means 'hard work pays'(c) '614' means 'work and study'Which of the following are the codes for 'pays' and 'work' respectively?Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.1 & 5
  • B.5 & 6
  • C.7 & 6
  • D.4 & 5
Correct Answer: 7 & 6

Code for ‘pays’ = 7

Code for ‘work’ = 6

Question 25
A policeman goes 20 meters towards South and then turns to his right and walks 40 meters. He again turns to his left and walks 10 meters. How far is he now from his starting point? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.37.5 meters
  • B.50 meters
  • C.302meters
  • D.40 meters
Correct Answer: 50 meters

OAD and BFD are similar triangles.

So, 2040-x = 10x

or x = 403 m

OF = FD + DO

= 102+4032 + 202+8032

= 50 m

Question 26
If the statement - "No professors are materialists" is given as true, then which of the following statements could be inferred to be true? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.All professors are materialists.
  • B.Some professors are materialists.
  • C.Some professors are not materialists.
  • D.Some materialists are professors.
Correct Answer: Some professors are not materialists.

Option C will be the inferred to be true based on the given statement (type ‘E’).

Question 27
Which of the following statements is logically equivalent to the statement- "No professors are materialists”? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Some non-materialists are not non-professors
  • B.Some professors are non-materialists
  • C.All professors are non-materialists
  • D.All non-materialists are non-professors
Correct Answer: All professors are non-materialists

Option C is obversion of original statement.

Question 28
Which of the following propositions are so related that they cannot both be true, although they can both be false? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)(a) No professors are materialists(b) Some professors are materialists(c) All professors are materialists(d) Some professors are not materialistsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.(a) and (c) Only
  • B.(b) and (d) Only
  • C.(b) and (c) Only
  • D.(a) and (d) Only
Correct Answer: (a) and (c) Only

In case of contrary, propositions are so related that they cannot both be true, although they can both be false. Therefore correct answer is option A.

Question 29
"To solve our transportation problems, we have to put more money into production of bicycles. The CEO of ABCD Company limited says so. "Which of the following fallacy is committed in the above argument? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Slippery Slope
  • B.Appeal to Inappropriate Authority
  • C.Ad Hominem
  • D.Hasty Generalization
Correct Answer: Appeal to Inappropriate Authority

Appeal to Inappropriate authority fallacy occurs when someone uses an irrelevant authority figure to support a claim.

The argument relies on the statement of a CEO from a company (ABCD Company Limited) to support its claim about solving transportation problems through increased bicycle production. CEOs might be experts in running companies, but they might not necessarily be transportation specialists. In this case, appealing to a more relevant authority on transportation, such as a traffic engineer or urban planner, would hold more weight.

Question 30
According to Classical Indian School of logic (Nya-ya) which fallacy is committed in the following statement?"The sky rose is fragrant, because it is a rose like the rose on the earth". (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Asa-dha-rana
  • B.Ba-dhita
  • C.Viruddha
  • D.A-s´raya-siddha
Correct Answer: A-s´raya-siddha

Option D is the correct answer.

A-s´raya- siddha

Here the minor term is the locus of the middle term. If the minor term is unreal, the middle term cannot be present in it; e.g., ‘the sky-lotus is fragrant, because it is a lotus, like the lotus of a lake’.

Question 31
Which of the following pair of acronym and its expansion are incorrectly matched? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.LED - Light Emitting Diode
  • B.CRT - Cathode Ray Tube
  • C.LCD - Liquid Control Display
  • D.VDU - Video Display Unit
Correct Answer: LCD - Liquid Control Display

The correct expansion for LCD is "Liquid Crystal Display, therefore, option (C) is incorrectly matched.

Question 32
Businesses use ICT to build positive customer relations by: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Calling customers at home
  • B.Creating targeted marketing campaigns
  • C.Placing pop-up advertisements on web sites
  • D.Sending unsolicited e-mails
Correct Answer: Creating targeted marketing campaigns

Targeted marketing campaigns allow businesses to tailor their messages and promotions to specific customer segments based on demographics, interests, and behavior. This approach helps businesses engage with customers more effectively, deliver relevant content, and build stronger relationships based on personalized interactions.

 

The other options listed are:

 

(A) Calling customers at home: This can sometimes be intrusive and may not always contribute to building positive customer relations.

(C) Placing pop-up advertisements on websites: Pop-up advertisements can be disruptive and may not always result in positive interactions with customers.

(D) Sending unsolicited emails: Sending unsolicited emails, also known as spam, can damage relationships with customers and is generally not an effective strategy for building positive customer relations.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option B.

Question 33
Given below are two statements:Statement I:(25)16=(00100101)2Statement II:(0011011)2=(1B)16In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

(25)16= 5 × 160 + 2 × 161 = 37

(00100101)2 = 1 × 20 + 1 × 22 + 1 × 25 = 37

Thus, (25)16= (00100101)2

also, (0011011)2 = 1 × 20 + 1 × 21 + 1 × 23 + 1 × 24 = 27

(1B)16 = 11 × 160 + 1 × 161 = 27

Thus, 00110112= 1B16

Thus, both the statements are correct.

Question 34
Which of the following statements is/are true?(a) BIOS is an example of Application Software(b) A utility software is an example of firmware(c) Spyware is an example of malwareChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a) Only
  • B.(b) Only
  • C.(c) Only
  • D.(b) and (c) Only
Correct Answer: (c) Only

Option C is correct.

The statement "BIOS is an example of Application Software" is false. BIOS (Basic Input/Output System) is firmware, not application software.

The statement "A utility software is an example of firmware" is false. Utility software is not firmware; it's a type of application software designed to perform specific tasks related to managing and maintaining a computer system.

The statement "Spyware is an example of malware" is true. Spyware is indeed a type of malware designed to gather information from a computer system without the user's knowledge or consent.

Question 35
Which of the following statements regarding guided and unguided media in computer Networking are correct?(a) Guided media transmission supports higher data speeds than unguided media transmission(b) Guided media is subjected to less interference than unguided media(c) Unguided media transmission is more secure than guided media transmissionChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(a) and (c) Only
  • C.(b) and (c) Only
  • D.(a), (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a) and (b) Only

Option A is correct.

The statement "Guided media transmission supports higher data speeds than unguided media transmission" is true. Guided media, such as twisted pair cables, coaxial cables, and fiber optic cables, provide a physical path for data transmission, which allows for higher data speeds compared to unguided media, such as wireless transmission.

The statement "Guided media is subjected to less interference than unguided media" is also true. Guided media, being physically bounded, are less susceptible to external interference compared to unguided media, which are often affected by environmental factors like atmospheric conditions, obstacles, and other electronic devices.

The statement "Unguided media transmission is more secure than guided media transmission" is false. Generally, guided media transmission is more secure than unguided media transmission. Guided media, especially wired connections like fiber optics, are harder to intercept compared to unguided media, such as wireless transmissions, which can be intercepted more easily through eavesdropping or jamming.

Question 36
Which of the following statements are true about hardness in water?(a) It is caused by ions of calcium and magnesium(b) It is of two types-temporary and permanent(c) Permanent hardness can easily be removed by heating the water(d) Hardness causes scales in hot water pipe systems(e) Hardness decreases the soap consumptionChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b), (c) and (d) Only
  • B.(a), (b) and (d) Only
  • C.(b), (c), (d) and (e) Only
  • D.(c), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (d) Only

Option B is correct.

Statement (a) is true. It is caused by ions of calcium and magnesium. Hardness in water is primarily caused by the presence of calcium (Ca2+) and magnesium (Mg2+) ions.

Statement (b) is true. It is of two types-temporary and permanent. Hardness in water is classified into temporary hardness, which is caused by the presence of bicarbonate ions (HCO3-) of calcium and magnesium, and permanent hardness, which is caused by the presence of sulfates and chlorides of calcium and magnesium.

Statement (d) is true. Hardness causes scales in hot water pipe systems. Hardness in water causes the deposition of scale (calcium carbonate) in hot water pipe systems, which can lead to reduced flow rates and efficiency issues in heating systems.

Question 37
What is the full form of CBOD? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Comparative Biochemical Oxygen Demand
  • B.Common Biochemical Oxygen Demand
  • C.Carbonaceous Biochemical Oxygen Demand
  • D.Classified Biochemical Oxygen Demand
Correct Answer: Carbonaceous Biochemical Oxygen Demand

The full form of CBOD is Carbonaceous Biochemical Oxygen Demand.

Question 38
Given below are two statements:Statement I:RSPM are those suspended particulate matters (SPM) whose aerodynamic diameter is more than 10 micron.Statement II:Fine particles are those SPM whose aerodynamic diameter is less than 2.5 micron.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct

Option D is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. RSPM, or Respirable Suspended Particulate Matter, typically refers to particles with aerodynamic diameters less than or equal to 10 microns, not more than 10 microns. Larger particles are generally referred to as Total Suspended Particulate Matter (TSPM).

Statement II is correct. Fine particles, often denoted as PM2.5, indeed refer to particles with aerodynamic diameters less than 2.5 microns.

Question 39
Which one of the following is responsible for the negativeradiativeforcing or cooling of the atmosphere? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Watervapour
  • B.Tropospheric Ozone
  • C.Stratospheric Ozone
  • D.Black carbon
Correct Answer: Stratospheric Ozone

Option C is correct.

Negative radiative forcing refers to factors that contribute to cooling the Earth's atmosphere by reducing the amount of solar radiation reaching the Earth's surface or by enhancing the reflection of incoming solar radiation back into space.

Stratospheric ozone (O3) is responsible for negative radiative forcing or cooling of the atmosphere. Ozone in the stratosphere absorbs incoming ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun, preventing it from reaching the Earth's surface. This absorption of UV radiation leads to a cooling effect on the atmosphere.

Question 40
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Montreal protocol is a multi-lateral environmental agreement that regulates the production and consumption of nearly 100 man-made chemicals.Statement II:Montreal protocol is an international treaty designed to protect the environment.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.

 

Statement I: Montreal Protocol is a multilateral environmental agreement that regulates the production and consumption of nearly 100 man-made chemicals known as ozone-depleting substances (ODS). It aims to phase out the production and use of these substances to protect the ozone layer.

Statement II: Montreal Protocol is an international treaty designed to protect the environment, specifically the Earth's ozone layer, by regulating the production and consumption of ODS.

Question 41
The first Indian Universities Commission (1902) was headed by: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.GurudasBannerjee
  • B.SyedHasanBilgrami
  • C.William Adam
  • D.Thomas Raleigh
Correct Answer: Thomas Raleigh

The first Indian Universities Commission (1902) was headed by Thomas Raleigh.

Question 42
Which of the following were established during the rule of East India company in India?(a) St. Stephen's College, Delhi(b)HislopCollege, Nagpur(c) Fort William College, Calcutta(d)SeramporeCollege,Serampore(e) Poona Sanskrit College, PuneChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(a), (b) and (e) Only
  • D.(c), (d) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (c), (d) and (e) Only

During the rule of the East India Company in India (1785-1858), several educational institutions were established. Among the options provided, Fort William College in Calcutta (established in 1800), Serampore College in Serampore (established in 1818), and Poona Sanskrit College in Pune (established in 1821) were founded during this period.

 

St. Stephen's College in Delhi (established in 1881) and Hislop College in Nagpur (established in 1883) were established later and therefore were not established during the rule of the East India Company.

 

Hence, the correct answer is option D, which includes Fort William College, Serampore College, and Poona Sanskrit College.

Question 43
Match List - IwithList - II.List - I (Committee/Commission)(a) Scientific Manpower Committee (1947)(b) Committee on Higher Education in rural areas(c) Committee on Model Act for universities, 1961(d) Sanskrit CommissionList - II (Chairman)(I) K.L.Shrimali(II) S.S.Bhatnagar(III)SunithKumarChatterji(IV) D.S KothariChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a)-(I), (b)-(II), (c)-(III), (d)-(IV)
  • B.(a)-(II), (b)-(I), (c)-(IV), (d)-(III)
  • C.(a)-(III), (b)-(IV), (c)-(I), (d)-(II)
  • D.(a)-(IV), (b)-(III), (c)-(II), (d)-(I)
Correct Answer: (a)-(II), (b)-(I), (c)-(IV), (d)-(III)

The correct match is as follows.

List - I – List II

(Committee/Commission) - (Chairman)

(a) Scientific Manpower Committee (1947) - S.S. Bhatnagar

(b) Committee on Higher Education in rural areas - K.L. Shrimali

(c) Committee on Model Act for universities, 1961 - D.S Kothari

(d) Sanskrit Commission - Sunith Kumar Chatterji

Question 44
Given below are two statements:Statement I:The ancient university ofSridhanyakatakwas situated on the banks of river Yamuna.Statement II:Sridhanyakatakattained celebrity as the seat of bothBrahmanicaland Buddhist learning during the time of SiddhaNagarjuna.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct

Indian Sridhanya Katak University attained fame as a seat of learning for both Brahmanical and Buddhist during the time of Siddha Nagarjuna. Sridhanya Katak was situated on the banks of the Krishna.

Therefore, statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

Question 45
In 1948, under whose chairpersonship a University Commission was appointed with the purpose of reconstruction of university education to meet the demand for scientific, technical and other manpower needed for the socio-economic development of the country? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Dr.ZakirHusain
  • B.Dr. S.Radhakrishnan
  • C.Dr. A.LMudaliar
  • D.Dr. D.S. Kothari
Correct Answer: Dr. S.Radhakrishnan

Radhakrishnan Commission, also known as University Education Commission, was set up by the Government of India after independence under the chairmanship of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan on November 4, 1948.

Question 46
Project Tiger turned 50 last week recently. An often repeated headline was how the numbers have increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022. This hides the bitter truth: Indians aren’t going to compromise Western lifestyles for the survival of the Tiger. Most middle class Indians would loathe to give up their second, investment home or driving to the hills on amultilanedhigh way for the national animal.You also can’t change the needs of a tiger — it is a large, solitary animal. A female tiger needs about 15 square kilometers with a good prey base. If she reproduces, those cubs will require additional space. Data shows 30% of the tigers live outside protected areas, i.e., in our midst. The more we fragment their habitat with urbanization, highways and industrial parks, the more they will be forced into unprotected areas.Let’s modify our approach. I advocate for three results by the 75th anniversary of Project Tiger. First, instead of endlessly increasing tiger populations, India can identify and achieve a metric, not much higher than the current numbers. Remember, 1000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, more will be a disaster. Second, let’s better protect what we have. Keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed is key. Investment in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact should be financially viable and part of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and more. Third, reducing confrontation with humans is essential. Monitoring and communications technology are key to this. Compensation for livestock killed must be rapidly assessed and pegged to market rates. For the next quarter century, let’s think quality.Over the last few years, the population of the tiger has: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Decreased
  • B.Remained static
  • C.Increased
  • D.Declined substantially
Correct Answer: Increased

The passage mentions that the population of tigers has increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022.

Question 47
Project Tiger turned 50 last week recently. An often repeated headline was how the numbers have increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022. This hides the bitter truth: Indians aren’t going to compromise Western lifestyles for the survival of the Tiger. Most middle class Indians would loathe to give up their second, investment home or driving to the hills on amultilanedhigh way for the national animal.You also can’t change the needs of a tiger — it is a large, solitary animal. A female tiger needs about 15 square kilometers with a good prey base. If she reproduces, those cubs will require additional space. Data shows 30% of the tigers live outside protected areas, i.e., in our midst. The more we fragment their habitat with urbanization, highways and industrial parks, the more they will be forced into unprotected areas.Let’s modify our approach. I advocate for three results by the 75th anniversary of Project Tiger. First, instead of endlessly increasing tiger populations, India can identify and achieve a metric, not much higher than the current numbers. Remember, 1000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, more will be a disaster. Second, let’s better protect what we have. Keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed is key. Investment in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact should be financially viable and part of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and more. Third, reducing confrontation with humans is essential. Monitoring and communications technology are key to this. Compensation for livestock killed must be rapidly assessed and pegged to market rates. For the next quarter century, let’s think quality.An increase in tiger population will result in: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Tigers killing each other
  • B.Tigers dying
  • C.Tigers posing a threat to the farms and villages nearly
  • D.Tigers eating their own cubs
Correct Answer: Tigers posing a threat to the farms and villages nearly

The passage suggests that an increase in tiger population could pose a threat to farms and villages nearby. It mentions that 1,000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, and having more tigers could potentially lead to disasters or conflicts with human settlements.

Question 48
Project Tiger turned 50 last week recently. An often repeated headline was how the numbers have increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022. This hides the bitter truth: Indians aren’t going to compromise Western lifestyles for the survival of the Tiger. Most middle class Indians would loathe to give up their second, investment home or driving to the hills on amultilanedhigh way for the national animal.You also can’t change the needs of a tiger — it is a large, solitary animal. A female tiger needs about 15 square kilometers with a good prey base. If she reproduces, those cubs will require additional space. Data shows 30% of the tigers live outside protected areas, i.e., in our midst. The more we fragment their habitat with urbanization, highways and industrial parks, the more they will be forced into unprotected areas.Let’s modify our approach. I advocate for three results by the 75th anniversary of Project Tiger. First, instead of endlessly increasing tiger populations, India can identify and achieve a metric, not much higher than the current numbers. Remember, 1000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, more will be a disaster. Second, let’s better protect what we have. Keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed is key. Investment in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact should be financially viable and part of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and more. Third, reducing confrontation with humans is essential. Monitoring and communications technology are key to this. Compensation for livestock killed must be rapidly assessed and pegged to market rates. For the next quarter century, let’s think quality."The bitter truth" refers to: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Tigers living outside protected areas
  • B.Human killing tigers
  • C.The conflicting needs of human beings and tigers
  • D.Tigers killing human beings
Correct Answer: The conflicting needs of human beings and tigers

In the passage, the phrase "bitter truth" is used to refer to the conflict between the conservation of tigers and the lifestyle preferences of humans. It highlights the challenge of balancing the needs of tiger conservation with the desires of humans for their own lifestyles, such as owning second homes or driving on highways.

Question 49
Project Tiger turned 50 last week recently. An often repeated headline was how the numbers have increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022. This hides the bitter truth: Indians aren’t going to compromise Western lifestyles for the survival of the Tiger. Most middle class Indians would loathe to give up their second, investment home or driving to the hills on amultilanedhigh way for the national animal.You also can’t change the needs of a tiger — it is a large, solitary animal. A female tiger needs about 15 square kilometers with a good prey base. If she reproduces, those cubs will require additional space. Data shows 30% of the tigers live outside protected areas, i.e., in our midst. The more we fragment their habitat with urbanization, highways and industrial parks, the more they will be forced into unprotected areas.Let’s modify our approach. I advocate for three results by the 75th anniversary of Project Tiger. First, instead of endlessly increasing tiger populations, India can identify and achieve a metric, not much higher than the current numbers. Remember, 1000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, more will be a disaster. Second, let’s better protect what we have. Keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed is key. Investment in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact should be financially viable and part of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and more. Third, reducing confrontation with humans is essential. Monitoring and communications technology are key to this. Compensation for livestock killed must be rapidly assessed and pegged to market rates. For the next quarter century, let’s think quality.According to the writer, one of the aims of project Tiger in the next quarter century should be: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Increasing tiger population
  • B.Training the tigers to live in a contained area
  • C.Protecting the existing tiger population
  • D.Ensuring that the government stops building highways
Correct Answer: Protecting the existing tiger population

The writer advocates for better protecting the existing tiger population as one of the aims of Project Tiger in the next quarter century. This involves keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed and investing in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact, which aligns with the goal of safeguarding the current tiger population rather than endlessly increasing it.

Question 50
Project Tiger turned 50 last week recently. An often repeated headline was how the numbers have increased from 2,967 individuals in 2018 to 3,167 in 2022. This hides the bitter truth: Indians aren’t going to compromise Western lifestyles for the survival of the Tiger. Most middle class Indians would loathe to give up their second, investment home or driving to the hills on amultilanedhigh way for the national animal.You also can’t change the needs of a tiger — it is a large, solitary animal. A female tiger needs about 15 square kilometers with a good prey base. If she reproduces, those cubs will require additional space. Data shows 30% of the tigers live outside protected areas, i.e., in our midst. The more we fragment their habitat with urbanization, highways and industrial parks, the more they will be forced into unprotected areas.Let’s modify our approach. I advocate for three results by the 75th anniversary of Project Tiger. First, instead of endlessly increasing tiger populations, India can identify and achieve a metric, not much higher than the current numbers. Remember, 1000 tigers already roam around in farms and villages, more will be a disaster. Second, let’s better protect what we have. Keeping protected tiger habitat undisturbed is key. Investment in keeping unprotected ecosystems intact should be financially viable and part of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and more. Third, reducing confrontation with humans is essential. Monitoring and communications technology are key to this. Compensation for livestock killed must be rapidly assessed and pegged to market rates. For the next quarter century, let’s think quality.According to the writer, the 75th Anniversary of project Tiger should not aim at the following:(a) Keep the protected habitats intact(b) Keep the tiger population about the same as at present(c)Live stockkilled by tigers should be adequately compensated for(d) Focus on quantity instead of qualityChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a) and (b) Only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) Only
  • C.(c) and (d) Only
  • D.(d) Only
Correct Answer: (d) Only

The writer emphasizes focusing on quality rather than quantity for the next quarter-century of Project Tiger. Therefore, the 75th Anniversary of Project Tiger should not aim at increasing the tiger population or solely focusing on quantity over quality.

Quiz Attempt #119740

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the details about money invested (principal) in a bank at a certain rate of interest for a given period of time by six different male persons A-F, along with the amount received (in ₹). Some values are missing in the table (indicated as '_') that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Person-wise Details of Money InvestedPersonRate of Interest (%)Time (in years)Principal (in ₹)Amount Received (in ₹)A6%-18000-B6%-30000-C-5-29000D-345000-E8%-20000-F-260000-If the rate of interest received by A and C is in the ratio of 2:3, then the money invested by C will get doubled in ________ years. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.1217
  • B.1512
  • C.1313
  • D.1119
Correct Answer: 1119

Rate of interest for C = 9% per annum

P = P×9×T100

or T = 11 19 years

Question 2
The following table shows the details about money invested (principal) in a bank at a certain rate of interest for a given period of time by six different male persons A-F, along with the amount received (in ₹). Some values are missing in the table (indicated as '_') that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Person-wise Details of Money InvestedPersonRate of Interest (%)Time (in years)Principal (in ₹)Amount Received (in ₹)A6%-18000-B6%-30000-C-5-29000D-345000-E8%-20000-F-260000-If the difference between the interest received by E and B is ₹ 4200 and E invested his money for double the time period for which B invested his money, then the amount received by E is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.₹30,000
  • B.₹ 28,600
  • C.₹ 29,600
  • D.₹ 35,400
Correct Answer: ₹ 29,600

Let B invested the money for t years, then E invested the money for 2t years.

So, 20000 × 8% × 2t - 30000 × 6% × t = 4200

or t = 3 years

Amount received by E = 20,000 + 20000 × 8% × 2 × 3

= 29600

Question 3
The following table shows the details about money invested (principal) in a bank at a certain rate of interest for a given period of time by six different male persons A-F, along with the amount received (in ₹). Some values are missing in the table (indicated as '_') that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Person-wise Details of Money InvestedPersonRate of Interest (%)Time (in years)Principal (in ₹)Amount Received (in ₹)A6%-18000-B6%-30000-C-5-29000D-345000-E8%-20000-F-260000-If the amount received by C is twice the money invested by him, then the amount he will receive after 2 years if he invests the same sum of money in compound interest for 2 years compounded half yearly, is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.₹ 21129.45
  • B.₹ 21929.45
  • C.₹ 21292.45
  • D.₹ 21992.45
Correct Answer: ₹ 21129.45

Let P be the principal amount. Then, P = P×R×5100

or R = 20%

P = 14500

Amount after 2 years = 14500(1.1)4 = Rs. 21229.45

Question 4
The following table shows the details about money invested (principal) in a bank at a certain rate of interest for a given period of time by six different male persons A-F, along with the amount received (in ₹). Some values are missing in the table (indicated as '_') that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Person-wise Details of Money InvestedPersonRate of Interest (%)Time (in years)Principal (in ₹)Amount Received (in ₹)A6%-18000-B6%-30000-C-5-29000D-345000-E8%-20000-F-260000-If the interest received by F is 20% of the sum invested by him then how much more money as interest he would have earned if he had invested the money in compound interest? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.₹ 700
  • B.₹ 600
  • C.₹ 300
  • D.₹ 400
Correct Answer: ₹ 600

Interest by Simple interest = 600005 = 12000

12000 = 60000×R×2100

R = 10% per annum

 

Interest by compound interest = P(1.1)2 – P

= 12600

Difference = 12600 – 12000 = Rs. 600

Question 5
The following table shows the details about money invested (principal) in a bank at a certain rate of interest for a given period of time by six different male persons A-F, along with the amount received (in ₹). Some values are missing in the table (indicated as '_') that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Person-wise Details of Money InvestedPersonRate of Interest (%)Time (in years)Principal (in ₹)Amount Received (in ₹)A6%-18000-B6%-30000-C-5-29000D-345000-E8%-20000-F-260000-If the interest received by F is ₹ 7,575 more than the interest received by D and the rate of interest received by F is 2% more than the rate of interest received by A, then the interest rate received by D is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.8%
  • B.1.3%
  • C.1.4%
  • D.1.5%
Correct Answer: 1.5%

Interest for F = 60000×8%×2100 = 9600

Interest received by D = 9600 – 7575 = 2025

Rate of interest = 2025×10045000×3 = 1.5%

Question 6
Which element of cooperative learning talks about 'sink and swim' together? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Individual accountability
  • B.PromotiveInteraction
  • C.Positive interdependence
  • D.Group processing
Correct Answer: Positive interdependence

The element of cooperative learning that involves "sink and swim" together is Positive interdependence. Positive interdependence refers to the idea that group members perceive that they are linked together in a way that one person's success helps others and that all group members share a common fate. In the context of "sink and swim" together, this means that members of the group are mutually reliant on each other's efforts and successes, leading to collective achievement or failure.

Question 7
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Canvais an online tool used to prepare creative content in the form of poster,infographics, presentations etc.Statement (II):Edpuzzleis an online tool used for creating interactive videos.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are incorrect.
  • C.Statement (I) is correct but Statement (II) is incorrect.
  • D.Statement (I) is incorrect but Statement (II) is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.

Canva is an online tool used to prepare creative content like posters, infographics, and presentations.

Edpuzzle helps educators use video to teach engaging lessons and interact with students using rich media.

Thus, both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.

Question 8
Which of the following are the characteristics of mental development of Adolescents?(a) Increased ability togeneralisethe facts(b) Development of memory and imagination(c) Decreased ability to deal with abstraction(d) Decreased ability to understand(e) Increased ability to solve problemsChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(c), (d) and (e) only
  • B.(a), (b) and (e) only
  • C.(a), (c) and (d)
  • D.(c) and (d) only
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (e) only

Adolescents typically experience increased ability to generalize facts (option a), development of memory and imagination (option b), and increased ability to solve problems (option e).

Question 9
In which approach the teacher presents a puzzling situation and students solve the problem by gathering data and testing their conclusions? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Discovery learning
  • B.Latent learning
  • C.Situated learning
  • D.Inquiry learning
Correct Answer: Inquiry learning

Inquiry learning is an approach where the teacher presents students with a puzzling situation or problem to solve. Instead of directly providing answers, students are encouraged to gather data, analyze information, and test their conclusions through investigation and experimentation. This method fosters critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a deeper understanding of concepts as students actively engage in the learning process.

Question 10
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):The long-term memory for information tied to a particular time and place, especially memory of the events in a person's life is called as Implicit Memory.Statement (II):The knowledge that we are not conscious of recalling but that influences ourbehaviouror thought without our awareness is called as Episodic Memory.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.

The long-term memory for information tied to a particular time and place, especially memory of the events in a person's life, is called Episodic Memory.

 

The knowledge that we are not conscious of recalling but that influences our behavior or thought without our awareness is called Implicit Memory.

 

Thus, both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.

Question 11
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):In Cross- Sectional research, a researcher studies the same population over time.Statement (II):In retrospective study, a researcher relies on people's memories and recollections of the past.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.

Option D is correct.

Statement I is false. In cross-sectional research, a researcher studies different individuals or groups from a population at a single point in time. It does not involve studying the same population over time; instead, it provides a snapshot of a population's characteristics at a specific moment.

Statement II is true. Retrospective studies, also known as retrospective or case-control studies, involve looking back in time to examine exposures or outcomes. Researchers rely on participants' memories and recollections of past events, exposures, or experiences to gather data for analysis.

Question 12
In naturalistic observation, the practice of dichotomous recording whether abehaviouroccurs or not, constitutes (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Cluster sampling
  • B.Time-interval sampling
  • C.One/zero sampling
  • D.Continuous real-time sampling
Correct Answer: One/zero sampling

Option C is correct.

In naturalistic observation, researchers often use various sampling techniques to systematically observe and record behaviors in their natural environment. One such technique is one/zero sampling, which involves recording whether a behavior occurs or not during a specified observation period.

One/zero sampling, also known as instantaneous sampling or point sampling, involves recording whether a behavior occurs (1) or does not occur (0) at specific moments in time. It is a form of dichotomous recording and is commonly used in naturalistic observation studies.

Question 13
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):According to UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarism, the authorities of a higher education institute cannot takeSuomotonotice of an act of plagiarism.Statement (II):Plagiarism means the practice of taking someone else's work or idea and passing them as one's own.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are incorrect.
  • C.Statement (I) is correct but Statement (II) is incorrect.
  • D.Statement (I) is incorrect but Statement (II) is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is incorrect but Statement (II) is correct.

As per UGC Regulation 2018 on Detection/Reporting/Handling of Plagiarism, if any member of the academic community suspects with appropriate proof that a case of plagiarism has happened in any document, he or she shall report it to the Departmental Academic Integrity Panel (DAIP). Upon receipt of such a complaint or allegation the DAIP shall investigate the matter and submit its recommendations to the Institutional Academic Integrity Panel (IAIP) of the HEI. The authorities of HEI can also take suomotu notice of an act of plagiarism and initiate proceedings under these regulations. Similarly, proceedings can also be initiated by the HEI on the basis of findings of an examiner. All such cases will be investigated by the IAIP.

Thus, statement (I) is incorrect.

UGC Regulation 2018 on Plagiarism defines the term ‘plagiarism’ as the practice of taking someone else’s work or idea and passing them as one’s own.

Thus, statement (II) is correct.

Question 14
For a perfect normal distribution, the median would be equal to which of the following measures?(a) Second quartile(b) Mean(c) 50th percentile(d) Mode(e) 5thdecileChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only.
  • B.(a), (b) and (d) only.
  • C.(a), (b), (c) and (d).
  • D.(a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e)

In a perfect normal distribution:

 

The second quartile corresponds to the median, which is the value separating the higher half from the lower half of the data.

The mean of a normal distribution is located exactly at the center, which coincides with the median.

The 50th percentile is another way of stating the median in terms of percentiles. It represents the value below which 50% of the observations fall.

The mode of a normal distribution, where the data are symmetrically distributed, also occurs at the peak of the distribution, which coincides with the median.

The 5th decile corresponds to the value below which 50% of the observations fall. In a perfectly normal distribution, the 5th decile is equal to the median.

Question 15
For which of the following p-value of a test statistic, a null hypothesis is likely to be rejected?(a) 0.38 of 2%(b) 38%(c) 2%(d) 0.46Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a) and (b) only.
  • B.(a) and (c) only.
  • C.(b) and (c) only.
  • D.(b) and (d) only.
Correct Answer: (a) and (c) only.

In hypothesis testing, a p-value represents the probability of obtaining a test statistic as extreme as, or more extreme than, the observed results, assuming that the null hypothesis is true. A smaller p-value indicates stronger evidence against the null hypothesis. Typically, if the p-value is less than or equal to the significance level (usually denoted as α, often set at 0.05), the null hypothesis is rejected.

So, in this case:

Option (a) has a p-value of 0.38 or 2%, which is smaller than the commonly used significance level of 0.05, suggesting rejection of the null hypothesis.

Option (b) with a p-value of 38% is much larger than the typical significance level, indicating insufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis.

Option (c) has a p-value of 2%, meeting the criteria for rejecting the null hypothesis.

Option (d) with a p-value of 0.46 is also smaller than 0.05, suggesting rejection of the null hypothesis.

Thus, the correct answer is (B).

Question 16
From the communication viewpoint, the Indian rhetoric, in its Hindu and Buddhist forms, has a/an: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Materialist basis
  • B.Ethical basis
  • C.Euro-centric basis
  • D.Non-religious basis
Correct Answer: Ethical basis

Indian rhetoric, particularly in its Hindu and Buddhist forms, often emphasizes ethical principles and values in communication. These traditions place significant importance on concepts such as dharma (duty or righteousness), ahimsa (non-violence), compassion, and mindfulness. Communication in these contexts is often aimed at promoting moral behavior, fostering understanding, and cultivating harmony among individuals and communities. Therefore, the rhetoric in Hindu and Buddhist traditions in India is primarily grounded in ethical principles rather than materialism, Euro-centric perspectives, or non-religious ideologies.

Question 17
The paradoxical relationship between body and mind in a communication environment results in: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Mindfulness
  • B.Self-importance
  • C.Obedience
  • D.Humour
Correct Answer: Humour

The paradoxical relationship between body and mind in a communication environment results in humour.

Humour often arises from incongruities or paradoxes, including those between the body and mind. When there is a discrepancy or unexpected connection between physical actions or appearances and mental states or intentions, it can lead to humor. This paradoxical relationship can be a source of amusement and laughter in communication.

Question 18
Which of the following are essential components of dialogic communication, according to RichardJohannesen?(a) A facade of pleasant greeting(b) possessive warmth for others(c) Empathic understanding(d) Spirit of mutual equality(e) Positive regard for othersChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e)
  • D.(a), (d) and (e) only
Correct Answer: (c), (d) and (e)

Richard Johannesen developed 6 components of dialogic communication that can be used to practice ethical public relations including: genuineness, accurate empathetic understanding, unconditional positive regard, presentness, spirit of mutual equality, and supportative psychological climate to describe dialogical communication.

 

Genuineness describes the idea that each person should be open and honest during communication without the hindrance of personal agendas.

 

Accurate and empathetic understanding refers to the concept of seeing and feeling the other person’s position on the issue being discussed.

 

Unconditional positive regard involves accepting the other person, possibly without accepting his ideas or behaviors. In this component, each person values the other and what the individual brings to the conversation.

 

Presentness involves paying attention, being truthful, and becoming completely involved in the transaction.

 

The spirit of mutual equity refers to the lack of power or superiority among those within the communication transaction.

 

Finally, supportative psychological climate involves encouraging each other to express opinions openly and freely. Judgment is avoided and assumptions are reduced.

 

Thus, correct answer is option C.

Question 19
The non-verbal communication is studied across which of the following disciplines?(a) Physics(b) Chemistry(c) Linguistics(d) Social psychology(e) AnthropologyChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) only
  • C.(c), (d), and (e)
  • D.(a), (b) and (e) only
Correct Answer: (c), (d), and (e)

Non-verbal communication is studied across multiple disciplines that include:

 

Linguistics (option (c)): Linguistics explores the structure and use of language, including non-verbal aspects such as gestures, facial expressions, and body language.

 

Social psychology (option (d)): Social psychology investigates how individuals perceive, interpret, and interact with others, including the role of non-verbal cues in communication and social behavior.

 

Anthropology (option (e)): Anthropology studies human societies and cultures, including non-verbal communication patterns within different cultural contexts.

 

Physics (option (a)) and Chemistry (option (b)) primarily deal with the physical and chemical properties of matter, respectively, and do not directly focus on human communication or behavior, especially non-verbal aspects. Therefore, options (a) and (b) are not included in the correct answer.

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Every communication contains elements of both content and relationships.Statement (II):Eyebehaviourprovidesmetacommunicativecues.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.

Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.

 

Statement (I): Every communication contains elements of both content and relationships. This statement is true. Content refers to the literal message being conveyed, while relationships refer to the interpersonal dynamics and the way in which the communication affects the relationship between the sender and receiver. Both aspects are present in any communication exchange.

 

Statement (II): Eye behavior provides metacommunicative cues. This statement is also true. Metacommunication refers to communication about communication, and eye behavior, such as eye contact or gaze patterns, can convey additional information beyond the verbal message, such as interest, sincerity, or dominance.

Question 21
Find the correct sequence of five (5) missing letters which will complete the following letter series:daa_bc_cda_ a _ c _c(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.a, b, a, c, b
  • B.a, c, b, a, c
  • C.a, c, a, b, c
  • D.a, c, a, c, b
Correct Answer: a, c, a, b, c

The correct order is: daaabcccdaaabccc.

Question 22
If in a scheme, the word 'FATHER' is coded as '104', how the word MOTHER' will be coded in the same scheme? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.104
  • B.83
  • C.87
  • D.102
Correct Answer: 83

Option B is correct answer.

Question 23
A circle has the diameter same as the length of the side of an equilateral triangle. What is the ratio of their respective areas? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.11: 73
  • B.22:73
  • C.11:143
  • D.11:73
Correct Answer: 22:73

Let a be the side of the equilateral triangle.

Then, required ratio = π a2 : 34 a2

= 22 : 73

Question 24
An article is sold at a gain of 10%. Had it been sold forRs. 26 more, the profit would have been 15%. The cost price of the article is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Rs. 480/-
  • B.Rs. 500/-
  • C.Rs. 510/-
  • D.Rs. 520/-
Correct Answer: Rs. 520/-

Let CP = x

Then, SP = 1.1x

Now, 1.1x + 26 = 1.15x

or 0.05x = 26

or x = 520

Thus, cost price = Rs. 520.

Question 25
The difference between the compound interest and simple interest on ₹ 10,000/- for 3 years at 10% per annum is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.310
  • B.300
  • C.200
  • D.430
Correct Answer: 310

Required difference = P(1.1)3 – P – 0.3P = 0.031 P = Rs.310

Question 26
Arrange the following group of terms in order of increasing extension.(a) Mammal(b) Wildcat(c) Feline(d) Animal(e) VertebrateChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(b), (c), (a), (e), (d)
  • B.(d), (e), (a), (c), (b)
  • C.(d), (a), (e), (b), (c)
  • D.(c), (b), (e), (a), (d)
Correct Answer: (b), (c), (a), (e), (d)

Option A is correct.

Wildcat refers to a specific subgroup of felines, namely wild cats, which are narrower in extension than the other terms.

Felines are a subgroup of mammals, including domestic cats, wildcats, and big cats.

Mammals are a subgroup of animals characterized by specific traits such as mammary glands and hair/fur.

Vertebrates are a subgroup of animals characterized by having a backbone or spinal column.

Animal is the broadest term, encompassing all living organisms.

Question 27
"If you like ketchup and you also like ice cream, then you would sure like ketchup ice cream." Which fallacy is committed in this argument? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Ad Hominem
  • B.Hasty Generalization
  • C.Slippery Slope
  • D.Fallacy of composition
Correct Answer: Fallacy of composition

Fallacy of composition assumes that what is true for the individual parts is also true for the whole. In this case, the argument implies that because someone likes ketchup and ice cream individually, they will automatically like ketchup ice cream (the combination). However, liking the separate ingredients doesn't guarantee someone will enjoy the combined flavor. Ketchup and ice cream have very different taste profiles, and combining them might not be pleasant.

Question 28
Which formal fallacy is committed in the following argument: "No politicians are idiots. Some voters are not idiots. Therefore, some voters are not politicians"? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Exclusive Premises
  • B.Existential fallacy
  • C.Affirming the consequent
  • D.Denying the antecedent
Correct Answer: Exclusive Premises

Exclusive Premises fallacy occurs when both premises in a syllogism (a formal argument with two premises and a conclusion) are negative statements.

 

The argument states:

Premise 1: No politicians are idiots (negative statement).

Premise 2: Some voters are not idiots (negative statement).

Conclusion: Therefore, some voters are not politicians (affirmative statement).

 

The conclusion doesn't necessarily follow from the negative premises. Just because some voters are not idiots and no politicians are idiots, it doesn't mean there's no overlap between the two groups. Voters could be intelligent and still be politicians.

Question 29
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Inductive arguments can only be stronger or weaker.Statement (II):Deductive arguments are either invalid or valid.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are incorrect.
  • C.Statement (I) is correct but Statement (II) is incorrect.
  • D.Statement (I) is incorrect but Statement (II) is correct.
Correct Answer: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.

Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.

Question 30
In which of the following arguments the reason is counterbalanced by another reason as per classical Indian school of logic (Nya-ya)?(a) All things are non-eternal, because they are knowable.(b) Fire is cold because it is a substance.(c) Sound is eternal because it is produced.(d) Sound is a quality, because it is visible.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(b) and (c) only
  • B.(a) and (d) only
  • C.(c) and (d)
  • D.(b) and (d) only
Correct Answer: (b) and (d) only

This question has been dropped by UGC NET and maybe ignored.

Question 31
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):MyGov.isa platform through which Government of India aims to encourage citizen participation towards good governance by seeking their ideas and suggestions.Statement (II):MyGovplatform is developed by three of the formerFlipkartexecutives to provide a cashless and seamless payment experience.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.

Statement (I) is true.

MyGov is an innovative platform launched to ensure citizens' engagement in decision making by the Government so that the ultimate goal of "Good Governance" for building India is achieved. This initiative is an opportunity for citizens and well-wishers from across the world to share their views on key issues directly with the Prime Minister of India.

Statement (II) is false.

The start-up PhonePe is a UPI-based app, launched in December 2015 by three of the former Flipkart executives to provide a cashless and seamless payment.

Question 32
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Dropbox is an example of e-mail service on the Internet.Statement (II):Google Docs is an online word processor.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.

Statement (I): Dropbox is not an example of an email service on the Internet. Dropbox is a cloud-based file storage service that allows users to store and share files online, but it is not primarily an email service. Therefore, Statement (I) is false.

Google Docs is indeed an online word processor. Google Docs is a part of the Google Workspace (formerly G Suite) productivity suite and allows users to create, edit, and collaborate on documents online. Therefore, Statement (II) is true.

Question 33
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Dynamic RAM (DRAM) is the most common type of RAM used in computers, but where absolute speed is essential, Static RAM (SRAM) is the preferred technology.Statement (II):The Processors Memory Cache is the high-speed portion of the memory and SRAM is the effective technology for the sameIn light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.

Option A is correct.

Statement I is correct. DRAM is more commonly used due to its high density and lower cost, SRAM is preferred in situations where absolute speed is crucial, such as in cache memory.

Statement II is also correct. The processor's memory cache is indeed a high-speed portion of memory, and SRAM is frequently used in processor caches due to its fast access times.

Question 34
Which of the following statements A-D about Internet Cookies is/are true?(a) They are form of spyware.(b) They are used only in advertising.(c) They are used to track browser use.(d) They act in the same way as a virus.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a) only
  • B.(a) and (b) only
  • C.(c) only
  • D.(c) and (d) only
Correct Answer: (c) only

Option C is correct.

The statement "They are used to track browser use" is true. One of the primary functions of cookies is to track user interactions with websites. Cookies store information about user preferences, browsing history, and other data to provide a personalized browsing experience and track user behavior across different websites.

Question 35
Which of the following statements are correct with reference to Organic Light-Emitting Diodes (OLEDs)?(a) Because of plastic organic layers, OLEDs are much thicker and heavier than conventional LCD/LED formats.(b) OLEDs give a brighter light than LEDs leading to more vividcolours.(c) OLEDs produce a much larger field of view than LCD/LED formats.(d) OLEDs require some form of back-lighting so that the screen can be lit up.(e) OLEDs consume more power than LCD/LED formats and thus produce more heat.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(b), (c) and (e) only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e) only
  • D.(b) and (c) only
Correct Answer: (b) and (c) only

Option D is correct.

The statement "OLEDs give a brighter light than LEDs leading to more vivid colors" is true. OLEDs can produce brighter and more vibrant colors compared to traditional LEDs because they emit light directly when an electric current is applied, whereas LEDs typically require a backlight.

The statement "OLEDs produce a much larger field of view than LCD/LED formats" is true. OLEDs offer a wider viewing angle compared to LCD/LED formats because they emit light directly from each pixel, allowing for better visibility from different angles.

Question 36
Concept of salt gradient is utilized to store the heat energy in which of the following solar energy collecting systems? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Solar thermal collectors
  • B.Solar cells
  • C.Solar ponds
  • D.Solar kilns
Correct Answer: Solar ponds

Option C is correct.

Solar ponds are a type of solar energy collecting system that utilizes the concept of salt gradient to store heat energy. Solar ponds consist of a large body of saltwater with different concentrations of salt at different depths. Light penetrates the upper layers of the pond, heating the water. The bottom layer of the pond, which contains a high concentration of salt, acts as a thermal storage reservoir. The salt gradient prevents convection currents from mixing the layers, allowing the bottom layer to store heat for long periods of time. This stored heat energy can then be extracted for various applications such as space heating, water heating, or electricity generation. Therefore, the concept of salt gradient is utilized in solar ponds to store heat energy efficiently.

Question 37
Full form of PAN, a type of air pollutant, is: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Polycyclic Aromatic Nitrate
  • B.Polycyclic Acetyl Nitrate
  • C.PeroxyAromatic Nitrate
  • D.PeroxyAcetyl Nitrate
Correct Answer: PeroxyAcetyl Nitrate

Full form of PAN, a type of air pollutant, is Peroxy Acetyl Nitrate.

Question 38
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):Two categories of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) were class I and class II.Statement (II):Production of class II ODS ceased in 2000.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are incorrect.
  • C.Statement (I) is correct but Statement (II) is incorrect.
  • D.Statement (I) is incorrect but Statement (II) is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is correct but Statement (II) is incorrect.

Option C is correct.

Statement I is correct. Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) were categorized into two classes: Class I and Class II. Class I ODS includes substances like chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), halons, carbon tetrachloride, methyl chloroform, and methyl bromide. Class II ODS includes substances like hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs).

Statement II is incorrect. Production of Class II ODS did not cease in 2000. While the production and consumption of some Class II ODS, particularly CFCs, have been phased out under the Montreal Protocol due to their significant ozone-depleting potential, the phase-out process for other Class II ODS, such as HCFCs, has been ongoing with gradual reduction targets set for different countries. Therefore, the production of Class II ODS did not universally cease in 2000.

Question 39
Given below are two statements, one is labelled as Assertion ‘A’ and other one labelled as Reason ‘R’.Assertion ‘A’:Formaldehyde, widely used in plastics, wood products, insulating materials.glueand fabrics, is a serious allergen.Reason ‘R’:Allergens are substances that activate the immune system.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both ‘A’ and ‘R’ are correct and ‘R’ is the correct explanation of ‘A’.
  • B.Both ‘A’ and ‘R’ are correct but ‘R’ is NOT the correct explanation of ‘A’.
  • C.‘A’ is correct but ‘R’ is not correct.
  • D.‘A’ is not correct but ‘R’ is correct.
Correct Answer: Both ‘A’ and ‘R’ are correct but ‘R’ is NOT the correct explanation of ‘A’.

Option B is correct.

Assertion “A” is correct. Formaldehyde is indeed widely used in various products such as plastics, wood products, insulating materials, glue, and fabrics. It is considered a serious allergen, meaning it can trigger allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.

Reason “R” is correct. Allergens are substances that can activate the immune system, leading to allergic reactions in susceptible individuals. Formaldehyde is one such allergen that can stimulate the immune system and cause allergic responses.

Both assertion and reason are individually correct, but reason does not explain assertion because allergens activate the immune system is a general characteristic, but it does not specifically explain why formaldehyde, in particular, is a serious allergen

Question 40
During which one of the following the Convention on Biodiversity was opened for signature? (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Rio Summit
  • B.Stockholm conference
  • C.Ramsarconvention
  • D.Montreal Protocol
Correct Answer: Rio Summit

The Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) was made available for signature during the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development in June 1992. This conference, often referred to as the Earth Summit, was the largest intergovernmental gathering at that time. The summit took place from June 3rd to June 14th, 1992, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Question 41
The Hindu college of Calcutta was later renamed as: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Surendranathcollege
  • B.Ram Mohan Roy college
  • C.University/College
  • D.Presidency college
Correct Answer: Presidency college

The 'Hindoo College', established in 1817, was transformed into the 'Presidency College of Bengal' in 1855.

Question 42
Dr. B. R. Ambedkar was associated with:(a)Elphinstonecollege, Mumbai(b)Khalsacollege, Mumbai(c)Milindcollege, Aurangabad(d)Siddharthcollege, Mumbai(e) Fergusson college, PuneChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b), (c) and (d) only
  • B.(b), (c), (d), and (e) only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e) only
  • D.(a), (d) and (e) only
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c) and (d) only

Dr. B.R. Ambedkar ceaselessly worked for the upliftment of the Depressed Classes. He believed that the education of the Dalits would arouse their self confidance, would make them conscious of their rights and would induce them to fight against injustice and for their rights. He tried to educate them through his speeches, books, newspapers and institutions. His message to the Depressed Classes was, "Educate, Organize and Agitate". He established the People's Education Society in 1946, which founded the Siddhartha College at Bombay and the Milind College at Aurangabad. Dr. Ambedkar opened the Siddhartha College of Commerce and Economics in June 1953. Also, Guru Nanak Khalsa college, Mumbai, was the brainchild of Dr. Ambedkar. Thus correct answer is option A.

Question 43
Given below are two statements:Statement (I):The National Policy on Education (1986) intended to encourage inter-disciplinary research in social science.Statement (II):According to the National Policy on Education (1986) the idea of rural universities was untenable.In light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below. (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are true.
  • B.Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are false.
  • C.Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.
  • D.Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true.
Correct Answer: Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false.

The National Policy on Education (1986) aimed to promote interdisciplinary research in social sciences, as stated in Statement (I). This policy emphasized the need for research across various fields, including science and technology, social sciences, humanities, fine arts, and indology. It envisioned all institutions of higher education actively engaging in research, with research performance being a significant measure of success for both individuals and institutions.

 

Statement (II) inaccurately suggests that the National Policy on Education (1986) deemed the concept of rural universities as unfeasible. Contrary to this assertion, the policy actually envisaged the establishment and support of educational initiatives tailored to the needs of rural communities. It emphasized the development of educational programs aligned with the principles of Gandhian Basic Education and advocated for the integration of socially beneficial productive work, social service, and academic study. Additionally, the policy encouraged educational institutions and voluntary organizations to undertake initiatives based on this holistic educational approach.

Question 44
Which of the following fundamental principles of education are highlighted under New National Education Policy (2020)?(a) Higher education as a fundamental right.(b) Multi-disciplinarityand holistic education.(c) Outstanding research as part of higher education.(d) Promotion of multilingualism in teaching and learning.(e) Setting up of another knowledge commission.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e) only
  • D.(a), (d) and (e) only
Correct Answer: (b), (c) and (d) only

The Government approved the National Education Policy 2020 in July 2020. The new policy aims to pave way for transformational reforms in school and higher education systems in the country. This policy replaced the 34 years old National Policy on Education (NPE), 1986.

 

Key features of the policy are given below.

 

School Education

Universalization of education from pre-school to secondary level with 100% Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in school education by 2030.

To bring 2 crore out of school children back into the mainstream through an open schooling system.

The current 10+2 system to be replaced by a new 5+3+3+4 curricular structure corresponding to ages 3-8, 8-11, 11-14, and 14-18 years respectively. It will bring the uncovered age group of 3-6 years under school curriculum, which has been recognized globally as the crucial stage for development of mental faculties of a child. It will also have 12 years of schooling with 3 years of Anganwadi/ pre schooling.

Class 10 and 12 board examinations to be made easier, to test core competencies rather than memorized facts, with all students allowed to take the exam twice.

School governance is set to change, with a new accreditation framework and an independent authority to regulate both public and private schools.

Emphasis on Foundational Literacy and Numeracy, no rigid separation between academic streams, extracurricular, vocational streams in schools.

Vocational Education to start from Class 6 with Internships.

Teaching up to at least Grade 5 to be in mother tongue/regional language. No language will be imposed on any student.

Assessment reforms with 360 degree Holistic Progress Card, tracking Student Progress for achieving Learning Outcomes

A new and comprehensive National Curriculum Framework for Teacher Education (NCFTE) 2021, will be formulated by the National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE) in consultation with National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT).

By 2030, the minimum degree qualification for teaching will be a 4-year integrated B.Ed. degree.

 

Higher Education

Gross Enrolment Ratio in higher education to be raised to 50% by 2035. Also, 3.5 crore seats to be added in higher education. The current Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in higher education is 26.3%.

Holistic Undergraduate education with a flexible curriculum can be of 3 or 4 years with multiple exit options and appropriate certification within this period.

M. Phil courses will be discontinued and all the courses at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD level will now be interdisciplinary.

Academic Bank of Credits to be established to facilitate Transfer of Credits.

Multidisciplinary Education and Research Universities (MERUs), at par with IITs, IIMs, to be set up as models of best multidisciplinary education of global standards in the country.

The National Research Foundation will be created as an apex body for fostering a strong research culture and building research capacity across higher education.

Higher Education Commission of India (HECI) will be set up as a single umbrella body for the entire higher education, excluding medical and legal education. Public and private higher education institutions will be governed by the same set of norms for regulation, accreditation and academic standards. Also, HECI will be having 4 independent verticals namely,

National Higher Education Regulatory Council (NHERC) for regulation,

General Education Council (GEC) for standard setting,

Higher Education Grants Council (HEGC) for funding,

National Accreditation Council (NAC) for accreditation.

Affiliation of colleges is to be phased out in 15 years and a stage-wise mechanism to be established for granting graded autonomy to colleges. Over a period of time, every college is expected to develop into either an autonomous degree-granting College, or a constituent college of a university.

 

Other Changes

An autonomous body, the National Educational Technology Forum (NETF), will be created to provide a platform for the free exchange of ideas on the use of technology to enhance learning, assessment, planning, administration.

National Assessment Centre- ‘PARAKH’ has been created to assess the students.

It also paves the way for foreign universities to set up campuses in India.

It emphasizes setting up of Gender Inclusion Fund, Special Education Zones for disadvantaged regions and groups.

National Institute for Pali, Persian and Prakrit, Indian Institute of Translation and Interpretation to be set up.

It also aims to increase the public investment in the Education sector to reach 6% of GDP at the earliest. Currently, India spends around 4.6 % of its total GDP on education.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option B.

Question 45
Environmental education is needed for:(a) Conservation of natural resources.(b) Knowledge of causes of pollution.(c) Knowledge of measures to prevent pollution.(d) Extensive extraction of natural resources.(e)Economisingon scientific invention.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(b), (c) and (d) only
  • C.(c), (d) and (e)
  • D.(a), (d) and (e) only
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c) only
