This statement is false. Curzon's university reforms faced significant resistance from various sections of Indian society, including students, educators, and nationalists, who perceived these reforms as an attempt to undermine Indian education and impose British control.

Question 44
Match List - IwithList - IIList - I (Ancient thinkers)(a) Panini(b)Jivaka(c)Bhaskara(d)KanadaList - II (Area of study)(i) Astronomy(ii) Grammar(iii) Medicine(iv) PhysicsChoose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)
  • D.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(iv)

The correct match of the ancient thinkers with their respective areas of study is as follows.

(a) Panini - Grammar

(b) Jivaka - Medicine

(c) Bhaskara - Astronomy

(d) Kanada – Physics

Hence, option C is the correct answer.

Question 45
Match List - IwithList - II.List - 1 (Name of University)(a) Bombay University(b) Delhi University(c)UtkalUniversity(d) S.N.D.T. Women UniversityList - II (Year of Establishment)(I) 1916(II) 1943(III) 1922(IV) 1857Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(iii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)

The year of establishment of given universities is as follows.

(a) Bombay University - 1857

(b) Delhi University - 1922

(c) Utkal University - 1943

(d) S.N.D.T Women University – 1916

Thus, correct answer is option (A).

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the questions that follow :Science and the techniques to which it has given rise have changed human life during the last hundred and fifty years more than it had been changed since men took to agriculture, and the changes that are being wrought by science continue at an increasing speed. There is no sign of any new stability to be attained on some scientific plateau. On the contrary, there is every reason to think that the revolutionary possibilities of science extend immeasurably beyond what has so far been realised. Can the human race adjust itself quickly enough to these vertiginous transformations, or will it, as innumerable former species have done, perish from lack of adaptability? The dinosaurs were, in their day, the lords of creation, and if there had been philosophers among them, not one would have foreseen that the whole race might perish. But they became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. In the case of man and science there is a wholly new factor, namely that man himself is creating the changes of environment to which he will have to adjust himself with unprecedented rapidity. But, although man through his scientific skill is the cause of the changes of environment, most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Although they come about through human agencies, they have, or at any rate have had so far, something of the inexorable inevitability of natural forces. Whether Nature dried up the swamps or men deliberately drained them, makes little difference as regards the ultimate result. Whether men will be able to survive the changes of environment that their own skill has brought about is an open question. If the answer is in the affirmative, it will be known some day; if not, not. If the answer is to be in the affirmative, men will have to apply scientific ways of thinking to themselves and their institutions.Dinosaurs became extinct because of :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.A massive earthquake
  • B.Incessant rainfall
  • C.Extreme cold
  • D.Lack of adaptability
Correct Answer: Lack of adaptability

The passage states that dinosaurs became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. This lack of adaptability led to their extinction. Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the questions that follow :Science and the techniques to which it has given rise have changed human life during the last hundred and fifty years more than it had been changed since men took to agriculture, and the changes that are being wrought by science continue at an increasing speed. There is no sign of any new stability to be attained on some scientific plateau. On the contrary, there is every reason to think that the revolutionary possibilities of science extend immeasurably beyond what has so far been realised. Can the human race adjust itself quickly enough to these vertiginous transformations, or will it, as innumerable former species have done, perish from lack of adaptability? The dinosaurs were, in their day, the lords of creation, and if there had been philosophers among them, not one would have foreseen that the whole race might perish. But they became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. In the case of man and science there is a wholly new factor, namely that man himself is creating the changes of environment to which he will have to adjust himself with unprecedented rapidity. But, although man through his scientific skill is the cause of the changes of environment, most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Although they come about through human agencies, they have, or at any rate have had so far, something of the inexorable inevitability of natural forces. Whether Nature dried up the swamps or men deliberately drained them, makes little difference as regards the ultimate result. Whether men will be able to survive the changes of environment that their own skill has brought about is an open question. If the answer is in the affirmative, it will be known some day; if not, not. If the answer is to be in the affirmative, men will have to apply scientific ways of thinking to themselves and their institutions.In the scientific age who is responsible for the changingenvironment ?(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Nature
  • B.Man
  • C.Natural Disasters
  • D.Wars
Correct Answer: Man

The passage emphasizes that in the scientific age, man himself is responsible for the changes in the environment. It mentions that man, through his scientific skill, is the cause of these changes, even though most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the questions that follow :Science and the techniques to which it has given rise have changed human life during the last hundred and fifty years more than it had been changed since men took to agriculture, and the changes that are being wrought by science continue at an increasing speed. There is no sign of any new stability to be attained on some scientific plateau. On the contrary, there is every reason to think that the revolutionary possibilities of science extend immeasurably beyond what has so far been realised. Can the human race adjust itself quickly enough to these vertiginous transformations, or will it, as innumerable former species have done, perish from lack of adaptability? The dinosaurs were, in their day, the lords of creation, and if there had been philosophers among them, not one would have foreseen that the whole race might perish. But they became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. In the case of man and science there is a wholly new factor, namely that man himself is creating the changes of environment to which he will have to adjust himself with unprecedented rapidity. But, although man through his scientific skill is the cause of the changes of environment, most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Although they come about through human agencies, they have, or at any rate have had so far, something of the inexorable inevitability of natural forces. Whether Nature dried up the swamps or men deliberately drained them, makes little difference as regards the ultimate result. Whether men will be able to survive the changes of environment that their own skill has brought about is an open question. If the answer is in the affirmative, it will be known some day; if not, not. If the answer is to be in the affirmative, men will have to apply scientific ways of thinking to themselves and their institutions.The main focus of the passage is on :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Extinction of Species
  • B.Extinction of Dinosaurs
  • C.Science and Human life
  • D.Destruction of Forests
Correct Answer: Science and Human life

The passage primarily discusses the impact of science and its advancements on human life. It highlights how science has drastically changed human life over the past century and a half and how these changes continue to occur at an increasing speed. The passage also raises questions about whether the human race can adapt quickly enough to the transformations brought about by science or face potential consequences, drawing parallels with the extinction of species like dinosaurs. Therefore, the main focus is on the relationship between science and human life.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the questions that follow :Science and the techniques to which it has given rise have changed human life during the last hundred and fifty years more than it had been changed since men took to agriculture, and the changes that are being wrought by science continue at an increasing speed. There is no sign of any new stability to be attained on some scientific plateau. On the contrary, there is every reason to think that the revolutionary possibilities of science extend immeasurably beyond what has so far been realised. Can the human race adjust itself quickly enough to these vertiginous transformations, or will it, as innumerable former species have done, perish from lack of adaptability? The dinosaurs were, in their day, the lords of creation, and if there had been philosophers among them, not one would have foreseen that the whole race might perish. But they became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. In the case of man and science there is a wholly new factor, namely that man himself is creating the changes of environment to which he will have to adjust himself with unprecedented rapidity. But, although man through his scientific skill is the cause of the changes of environment, most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Although they come about through human agencies, they have, or at any rate have had so far, something of the inexorable inevitability of natural forces. Whether Nature dried up the swamps or men deliberately drained them, makes little difference as regards the ultimate result. Whether men will be able to survive the changes of environment that their own skill has brought about is an open question. If the answer is in the affirmative, it will be known some day; if not, not. If the answer is to be in the affirmative, men will have to apply scientific ways of thinking to themselves and their institutions."If the answer is in the affirmative _________" refers to the question related to :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.Changes in environment
  • B.Human survival
  • C.Human extinction
  • D.Changes in scientific approach
Correct Answer: Human survival

The passage discusses the potential survival of the human race in the face of rapid environmental changes brought about by scientific advancements. Therefore, "If the answer is in the affirmative" implies that if humans can iadapt quickly enough to these transformations, then their survival is plausible.

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the questions that follow :Science and the techniques to which it has given rise have changed human life during the last hundred and fifty years more than it had been changed since men took to agriculture, and the changes that are being wrought by science continue at an increasing speed. There is no sign of any new stability to be attained on some scientific plateau. On the contrary, there is every reason to think that the revolutionary possibilities of science extend immeasurably beyond what has so far been realised. Can the human race adjust itself quickly enough to these vertiginous transformations, or will it, as innumerable former species have done, perish from lack of adaptability? The dinosaurs were, in their day, the lords of creation, and if there had been philosophers among them, not one would have foreseen that the whole race might perish. But they became extinct because they could not adapt themselves to a world without swamps. In the case of man and science there is a wholly new factor, namely that man himself is creating the changes of environment to which he will have to adjust himself with unprecedented rapidity. But, although man through his scientific skill is the cause of the changes of environment, most of these changes are not willed by human beings. Although they come about through human agencies, they have, or at any rate have had so far, something of the inexorable inevitability of natural forces. Whether Nature dried up the swamps or men deliberately drained them, makes little difference as regards the ultimate result. Whether men will be able to survive the changes of environment that their own skill has brought about is an open question. If the answer is in the affirmative, it will be known some day; if not, not. If the answer is to be in the affirmative, men will have to apply scientific ways of thinking to themselves and their institutions.According to the passage the following are true :(a) Science is bringing about rapid changes.(b) There is every likelihood that a scientific plateau will be reached.(c) Man will definitely perish like the Dinosaurs.(d) There are chances that mankind may become extinct due to lack of adaptability.(e) Changes in the environment made through human agencies have so far shown almost the same inexorable inevitability as that of natural forces in the past.Choose the correct answer from the options given below :(UGC NET Paper - 1 December 2023)
  • A.(a), (d) and (e) Only
  • B.(a), (b) and (e) Only
  • C.(a) and (e) Only
  • D.(b), (c) and (e) Only
Correct Answer: (a), (d) and (e) Only

According to the passage, the following are true:

(i) Science is bringing about rapid changes.

(ii) There are chances that mankind may become extinct due to lack of adaptability.

(iii) Changes in the environment made through human agencies have so far shown almost the same inexorable inevitability as that of natural forces in the past.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (A), i.e., (a), (d) and (e) only.

Quiz Attempt #119744

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
Match List I with the List II. (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)LIST I (FALLACIES)(a) Bandwagon argument(b)Strawmanargument(c) Red Herring argument(d) Begging the questionLIST II (DESCRIPTION)(i) Arguermispresentsan opponent’s position(ii) Arguer assumes the point to be proven(iii) Arguer appeals to the reader’s or listener’s desire to be accepted or valued(iv) Arguer tries to distract the attention of the audience by raising irrelevant issueChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(i), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iv), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)

The correct answer is (C) (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii).

(a) Bandwagon argument: Appeals to the desire to be accepted or valued by a group (matches with description (iii)).

(b) Strawman argument: Misrepresents the opponent's position (matches with description (i)).

(c) Red Herring argument: Distracts the audience with an irrelevant issue (matches with description (iv)).

(d) Begging the question: Assumes the truth of the point being argued (matches with description (ii)).

Question 2
The following table shows Net National Income (in Lac Crore) and Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand) of India during the 5 year period from the year 2015 – 16 to 2019-20. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)YearNet National Income (in Lac Crore)Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand)2015-16122952016-171361052017-181511152018-191671262019-20177132Question: What is the average per capita Net National Income (in thousand rupee) per year?
  • A.103.25
  • B.114.6
  • C.110.3
  • D.108.6
Correct Answer: 114.6

Average per capita Net National Income = 95+105+115+126+1325 = 114.6

Question 3
The following table shows Net National Income (in Lac Crore) and Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand) of India during the 5 year period from the year 2015 – 16 to 2019-20. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)YearNet National Income (in Lac Crore)Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand)2015-16122952016-171361052017-181511152018-191671262019-20177132Question: In which year the percentage (%) increase in the Net National Income over the previous year was maximum?
  • A.2019-20
  • B.2018-19
  • C.2017-18
  • D.2016-17
Correct Answer: 2016-17

Required percentage:

Year

Net National Income (in Lac Crore)

Percentage Increase

2015-16

122

 

2016-17

136

136-122122 ×100 = 11.48

2017-18

151

151-136136 ×100 = 11.03

2018-19

167

167-151151 ×100 = 10.6

2019-20

177

177-167167 ×100 = 5.99

Thus, the percentage increase was maximum in 2016-2017 as compared to previous year.

Question 4
The following table shows Net National Income (in Lac Crore) and Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand) of India during the 5 year period from the year 2015 – 16 to 2019-20. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)YearNet National Income (in Lac Crore)Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand)2015-16122952016-171361052017-181511152018-191671262019-20177132Question: With reference to the year 2015-16, the percentage growth in the population of India by the year 2019-20 is:
  • A.≈ 6.2%
  • B.≈ 4.4%
  • C.≈ 7.1%
  • D.≈ 3.1%
Correct Answer: ≈ 4.4%

Population in 2015-2016 = 12200000095 = 1284211

Population in 2019-2020 = 177000000132 = 1340909

Percentage growth in population = 1340909-12842111284211 × 100 ≈ 4.41%

Question 5
The following table shows Net National Income (in Lac Crore) and Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand) of India during the 5 year period from the year 2015 – 16 to 2019-20. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)YearNet National Income (in Lac Crore)Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand)2015-16122952016-171361052017-181511152018-191671262019-20177132Question: What is the percentage increase (%) in per capita Net National Income during 5 years?
  • A.≈ 38.94%
  • B.≈ 48.24%
  • C.≈ 30.61%
  • D.≈ 42.40%
Correct Answer: ≈ 38.94%

Required percentage = 132-9595 × 100 ≈ 38.94%

Question 6
The following table shows Net National Income (in Lac Crore) and Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand) of India during the 5 year period from the year 2015 – 16 to 2019-20. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)YearNet National Income (in Lac Crore)Per capita Net National Income (in Thousand)2015-16122952016-171361052017-181511152018-191671262019-20177132Question: Assuming that the per capita Net national Income grows beyond the year 2019-20 at the average annual rate of increase (%) of the period (2015-16 to 2019-20), what will be its value (in thousand Rupees) at the end of the year 2020-21?
  • A.135.68
  • B.138.35
  • C.140.17
  • D.143.34
Correct Answer: 143.34

Per capita Net National Income increase in 2016-17 = 105-9595 × 100 = 10.53

Per capita Net National Income increase in 2017-18 = 115-105105 × 100 = 9.52

Per capita Net National Income increase in 2018-19 = 126-115115 × 100 = 9.57

Per capita Net National Income increase in 2019-20 = 132-126126 × 100 = 4.76

Average rate = 10.53+9.52+9.57+4.764 = 8.595

Per capita Net national income at the end of the year 2020-21 = 132×108.595100 = 143.34

Question 7
Which of the following are not the characteristics are of teacher-centered methods of teaching?A. Students are passive learnersB. Teachers act as facilitator for learningC. Teacher directs learning activitiesD. Learning is based on collaboration between studentsE. Learning is based on student interestChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C & D only
  • B.B & E only
  • C.B, D & E only
  • D.A & C only
Correct Answer: B, D & E only

Let us consider each statement one by one.

A. Students are passive learners: This is a characteristic of teacher-centered methods of teaching, where students typically receive information from the teacher and are expected to absorb it without much active participation.

 

B. Teachers act as facilitator for learning: This is not a characteristic of teacher-centered methods. In teacher-centered approaches, the teacher typically plays a dominant role in directing the learning process rather than acting solely as a facilitator. Instead, student-centered methods emphasize the facilitation of learning by the teacher.

 

C. Teacher directs learning activities: This is a characteristic of teacher-centered methods, where the teacher controls the flow of the lesson and directs students' learning activities.

 

D. Learning is based on collaboration between students: This is not a characteristic of teacher-centered methods. In teacher-centered approaches, collaboration between students might occur, but the primary focus is on the teacher directing learning activities rather than fostering collaboration among students. Collaborative learning is often more associated with student-centered approaches.

 

E. Learning is based on student interest: This is not a characteristic of teacher-centered methods. In teacher-centered approaches, the focus is often on delivering predetermined content rather than tailoring learning experiences to individual student interests. Instead, student-centered methods prioritize adapting instruction to match student interests and needs.

 

Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.

Question 8
Which of the following is tool used for creating and sharing online learning games?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Mentimeter
  • B.Padlet
  • C.Kahoot
  • D.Zoom
Correct Answer: Kahoot

The tool used for creating and sharing online learning games is option (C) Kahoot.

 

A. Mentimeter: Mentimeter is an interactive presentation and polling tool that allows presenters to engage with their audience through live polls, quizzes, word clouds, and more.

 

B. Padlet: Padlet is a digital canvas where users can create multimedia bulletin boards to share ideas, photos, videos, and more. It is often used for collaborative brainstorming, sharing resources, and collecting feedback.

 

C. Kahoot: Kahoot is a platform for creating, hosting, and playing learning games, quizzes, and surveys. It allows educators to create interactive quizzes and games that can be played by students in real-time using their smartphones, tablets, or computers. Kahoot is widely used in educational settings to engage students and assess their understanding of various topics through gamified quizzes.

 

D. Zoom: Zoom is a video conferencing platform that enables users to conduct online meetings, webinars, and virtual classrooms.

Question 9
What are the various salient features of formative evaluation? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. It provides feedback to the teachers to use teaching strategies according to the needs of the learnersB. It helps learners to actively and continuously engage in learningC. It helps in enhancing the learning abilities of the learnerD. It contributes to the overall grading and certification of the learnerE. It ‘sums-up’ how much a student has learnt over a period of timeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, D & E only
  • B.C & E only
  • C.A, B & C only
  • D.A & D only
Correct Answer: A, B & C only

Let us consider each statement one by one.

A. It provides feedback to the teachers to use teaching strategies according to the needs of the learners: This is a salient feature of formative evaluation. Formative evaluation focuses on providing ongoing feedback to teachers and students during the learning process to adjust teaching strategies and improve learning outcomes based on the needs of the learners.

 

B. It helps learners to actively and continuously engage in learning: This is a salient feature of formative evaluation. Formative evaluation encourages active participation and engagement of learners in the learning process by providing feedback, opportunities for self-assessment, and reflection to enhance learning.

 

C. It helps in enhancing the learning abilities of the learner: This is a salient feature of formative evaluation. Formative evaluation aims to identify strengths and weaknesses in students' learning and provide timely feedback and support to enhance their learning abilities and address areas needing improvement.

 

D. It contributes to the overall grading and certification of the learner: This is not a feature of formative evaluation. Formative evaluation focuses on providing feedback and improving learning during the learning process rather than assigning grades or certification. Summative evaluation is typically used for grading and certification purposes.

 

E. It 'sums-up' how much a student has learnt over a period of time: This is not a feature of formative evaluation. Formative evaluation focuses on assessing learning progress and providing feedback during the learning process, whereas summative evaluation is used to measure the overall achievement or learning outcomes at the end of a period of instruction.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 10
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: A learner’s cultural background has no impact on his/her learning experience.Statement II; Gender is not a strong predictor of academic achievement.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are true
  • B.Both statement I and II are false
  • C.Statement I is true and Statement II are false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

 

Statement I: A learner’s cultural background has no impact on his/her learning experience.

This statement is false. A learner's cultural background can significantly influence their learning experience. Cultural background shapes individuals' perspectives, values, and ways of learning. It can impact communication styles, preferences for instructional methods, and attitudes towards education. Teachers and educators should be aware of and sensitive to the cultural diversity of their students to create inclusive and effective learning environments.

 

Statement II: Gender is not a strong predictor of academic achievement.

This statement is true. While gender differences may exist in certain academic areas or contexts, gender alone is not a strong predictor of academic achievement. Factors such as individual abilities, motivation, socio-economic status, and access to resources play significant roles in determining academic success. It is important to recognize that variations in academic achievement are influenced by a complex interplay of multiple factors beyond just gender.

Question 11
Match List I with the List II: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)LIST I (Three approaches of education)(a) Teacher-centered(b) Learner-centered(c) Learning-centeredLIST II (Disciplinary aspects)(i) Shared, Participatory(ii) Imposed(iii) Self -controlledChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii)
  • D.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii)

The correct match is as follows.

 

(a) Teacher-centered - Imposed

In teacher-centered approaches, the teacher typically imposes the structure, content, and pace of learning on the students.

 

(b) Learner-centered - Shared, Participatory

Learner-centered approaches emphasize active participation and involvement of learners in the learning process, where students have a shared role in determining the direction and pace of learning.

 

(c) Learning-centered - Self-controlled

Learning-centered approaches focus on fostering self-directed learning and autonomy in students, where learners take control of their learning process, set goals, and monitor their own progress.

Question 12
Which among the following would be the ethical issues in a research study that involves participation of human subjects? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Lack of informed consentB. Physical and psychological harmC. Excessive inducementsD. DebriefingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B & C only
  • B.B, C & D only
  • C.A, C & D only
  • D.A, B, C & D
Correct Answer: A, B & C only

Option A is correct.

Ethical considerations are crucial in any research study involving human subjects to ensure their rights, safety, and well-being.

Lack of informed consent is a significant ethical issue. Informed consent ensures that participants are fully aware of the study's purpose, procedures, potential risks, and benefits before agreeing to participate. Without informed consent, participants may be unaware of the study's implications, leading to a violation of their autonomy and rights.

Physical and psychological harm is another important ethical consideration. Researchers must take measures to minimize the risk of physical or psychological harm to participants. This includes conducting risk assessments, providing adequate support and resources, and implementing safety protocols to protect participants' well-being.

Offering excessive inducements or incentives to participants can raise ethical concerns. It may unduly influence participants' decision to participate in the study, compromising their autonomy and potentially leading to coercion or exploitation.

While debriefing is an important ethical practice in research, it is not considered an ethical issue itself. Debriefing involves providing participants with additional information about the study, addressing any concerns or questions they may have, and ensuring that they leave the study feeling informed and supported.

Question 13
Which aspect of the researcher may cause psychological effect in the participant of study?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Age
  • B.Race
  • C.Sex
  • D.Attitude
Correct Answer: Attitude

Option D is correct.

The attitude of the researcher can significantly impact the psychological effects experienced by the participants of a study.

Empathy and Support: If the researcher demonstrates empathy, understanding, and support towards the participants, it can create a positive psychological environment. Participants may feel more comfortable, valued, and willing to share their experiences or thoughts, leading to more accurate data collection.

Respect and Non-Judgmental Attitude: Participants experience psychological distress if they perceive the researcher as judgmental or disrespectful towards their beliefs, experiences, or identities. A non-judgmental attitude fosters trust and openness, encouraging participants to express themselves without fear of criticism or stigma.

Professionalism and Integrity: Participants may be psychologically affected if they perceive the researcher as lacking professionalism or integrity. Any breaches of confidentiality, unethical behavior, or perceived biases can erode trust and negatively impact the participant-researcher relationship.

Communication Style: The way a researcher communicates with participants, including tone of voice, body language, and clarity of instructions, can influence participants' psychological responses. Clear, respectful communication promotes understanding and reduces anxiety, while ambiguous or disrespectful communication may induce stress or confusion.

Question 14
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: In a ratio scale, zero point is arbitraryStatement II: The nominal scale allows ordering/ranking of dataIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

Both Statement I and Statement II are false.

Statement I: In a ratio scale, zero point is arbitrary.

This statement is false. In a ratio scale, the zero point is not arbitrary. A ratio scale has a true zero point, meaning that a value of zero indicates the absence of the measured attribute, and it is meaningful and non-arbitrary. For instance, if you measure weight in kilograms, a weight of zero means that there is no weight.

 

Statement II: The nominal scale allows ordering/ranking of data.

This statement is false. The nominal scale is the simplest level of measurement used to categorize data into distinct categories or groups without any inherent order or ranking. It merely identifies different categories or labels without any implied order. Therefore, it does not allow for the ordering or ranking of data.

Question 15
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: The standard deviation of a series of repeated measurements estimates the likely size of the chance error in a single measurementStatement II: Bias affects all the measurements the same way, pushing them in the same directionIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:-
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Standard deviation is a measure of the dispersion or variability of a dataset. In the context of repeated measurements, the standard deviation provides an estimate of the variability or spread of individual measurements around the mean. It indicates the degree of scatter or random variation in the data, which can be attributed to chance errors or fluctuations. Therefore, standard deviation helps to assess the precision or reliability of measurements, with higher standard deviation indicating greater variability and potentially larger chance errors.

Statement II is true. Bias refers to systematic errors or inaccuracies that consistently skew measurements in one direction, either overestimating or underestimating the true value. Unlike random errors, which affect measurements unpredictably, bias influences all measurements in the same way, consistently shifting them in a particular direction. Therefore, bias introduces a consistent deviation from the true value across all measurements, leading to a lack of accuracy in the data.

Question 16
A researcher obtains the following p-values for sample correlation coefficients of different samples. Which of these can be considered significant at 1% level of significance? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. 0.004B. 0.99C. 0.995D. 0.001E. 0.1Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B & C only
  • B.B, D & E only
  • C.A & D only
  • D.B, C & E only
Correct Answer: A & D only

Option C is correct.

In hypothesis testing, the p-value represents the probability of obtaining an observed result (or more extreme) if the null hypothesis is true. A lower p-value indicates stronger evidence against the null hypothesis, suggesting that the observed result is unlikely to occur by random chance alone.

To determine statistical significance at a certain level, such as the 1% level of significance (α = 0.01), we compare the obtained p-value to the chosen significance level. If the p-value is less than or equal to the significance level, we reject the null hypothesis in favor of the alternative hypothesis.

0.004: This p-value is less than 0.01 (1% significance level). Therefore, it can be considered statistically significant at the 1% level.

0.99: This p-value is greater than 0.01. Therefore, it cannot be considered statistically significant at the 1% level.

0.995: Similar to option B, this p-value is greater than 0.01. Therefore, it cannot be considered statistically significant at the 1% level.

0.001: This p-value is less than 0.01 (1% significance level). Therefore, it can be considered statistically significant at the 1% level.

0.1: This p-value is greater than 0.01. Therefore, it cannot be considered statistically significant at the 1% level.

Question 17
If information flows from the media to the opinion leaders and from them to the targetaudience, the process is known as(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.One-step flow
  • B.Two-step flow
  • C.Step-by-step flow
  • D.Multi-step flow
Correct Answer: Two-step flow

The two-step flow theory of communication was proposed by sociologist Paul Lazarsfeld, Bernard Berelson, and Hazel Gaudet. According to this theory, information and ideas flow from the media to opinion leaders, who then interpret and disseminate them to the wider audience. Opinion leaders are individuals who are particularly knowledgeable or influential within their social networks and are respected for their opinions and expertise. They act as intermediaries or filters between the media and the broader audience.

Therefore, if information flows from the media to the opinion leaders and from them to the target audience, the process is known as the two-step flow of communication.

Question 18
From the viewpointofcommunicators,language and other symbolic systems are:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Inactive tools
  • B.Economic targets
  • C.Social targets
  • D.Cultural fantasies
Correct Answer: Social targets

Language and other symbolic systems are considered social targets from the viewpoint of communicators because they are the means through which individuals and groups communicate, share meanings, and construct social realities. These systems are used to convey messages, express ideas, beliefs, values, and norms within a society or culture. They play a crucial role in shaping social interactions, relationships, and identities. Therefore, understanding language and symbolic systems is essential for effective communication and meaningful social interaction.

Question 19
Which of the following are true in the case of audience for analog media? They are:A. Personally addressableB. Active campaignersC. largeD. HeterogeneousE. AnonymousChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.A, B, E only
  • D.C, D, E only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

Analog media refers to traditional forms of communication and storage that transmit information in a continuous, non-digital format.

 

The features of the audience of analog media are as follows.

 

1. Large: Analog media often have the potential to reach a large audience, especially traditional forms like television and radio broadcasting. Therefore, they can be characterized as large in terms of audience reach.

 

2. Heterogeneous: Analog media audiences tend to be heterogeneous, meaning they consist of diverse individuals with different backgrounds, interests, and characteristics. Analog media often appeal to broad demographics, contributing to their heterogeneous audience composition.

 

3. Anonymous: Analog media audiences can be relatively anonymous in the sense that individuals within the audience are not individually identifiable or personally targeted. They consume content as part of a broader, often anonymous, audience.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 20
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: The centralized control of signs and symbols of mediated communications may affect plurality of opinions on the internet.Statement II: The global corporate owners of internet companies aim only at profits, not the existence ofpluriverse.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false nut Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Note that UGC has given option A as answer to this question, however, statement II is not entirely true.

 

Statement I: This statement is true. Centralized control of signs and symbols, such as algorithms used by social media platforms or search engines, can indeed influence the diversity of opinions and information available on the internet. When a few entities have significant control over the distribution and visibility of content, it can impact the plurality of voices and perspectives represented online.

 

Statement II: While it's true that profit-making is a primary goal for many global corporate owners of internet companies, it's not entirely accurate to say they aim only at profits. Many companies also recognize the importance of maintaining a diverse online environment for various reasons, including user satisfaction, regulatory compliance, and social responsibility.

Question 21
Negative communicators usually express(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Verbal softness
  • B.Optimism
  • C.Pessimism
  • D.Distrust
Correct Answer: Pessimism

Negative communicators tend to focus on negative aspects, convey pessimistic viewpoints, and express doubts or concerns rather than optimism. They may emphasize potential problems, failures, or limitations in their communication, which can influence the overall tone and perception of the message. This pessimistic outlook can impact the effectiveness of communication and contribute to a less positive atmosphere in interactions.

Question 22
What number should replace question mark (?) in the series given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)3, 8, 17, 32, 57, ?, 177
  • A.100
  • B.89
  • C.95
  • D.106
Correct Answer: 100

21 + 12 = 3

22 + 22 = 8

22 + 32 = 17

24 + 42 = 32

25 + 52 = 57

Similarly

26 + 62 = 100

Question 23
If in a certain code ‘Generalization’ is written as 52627134819406, how the word ‘Oreganos’ be written in that code?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.07521680
  • B.07251608
  • C.07251806
  • D.72085106
Correct Answer: 07251608

From the given word, code for ‘Oreganos’ will be:

07251608

Question 24
Salary of a person decreases by 10% every year and his bonus increases by 24% every year. If his salary and bonuses at the end of 2020 wereRs. 8000 andRs. 2500 respectively, find the difference between his total earnings in March 2020 and March 2022.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 165 increase
  • B.Rs. 176 increase
  • C.Rs. 180 decrease
  • D.Rs. 176 decrease
Correct Answer: Rs. 176 decrease

Total earnings in 2020 = 8000 + 2500 = 10500

Total earnings in 2022 = 8000 1-101002 + 2500 1+241002= 6480 + 3844 = 10324

Decrease in total earnings = 10500 – 10324 = Rs. 176

Question 25
The population of a village is 11000. If the number of children increase by 11% and the number of adults increase by 20%,the population becomes 12660. Find the population of children and adults separately in the village.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.7000, 4000
  • B.4500, 6500
  • C.6000, 5000
  • D.5500, 5500
Correct Answer: 6000, 5000

Let population of children = x

Then population of adults = 11000 – x

As per the question, 1.11x + 1.2 (11000 – x) = 12660

or 1.1x – 1.2x + 13200 = 12660

or x = 6000

Thus, number of children = 6000

Number of adults = 11000 – 6000 = 5000

Question 26
There are fifteen successive percentage discounts given in a series of 2%, 4%, 6%, 8%, --- on an item. After how much such percentage discounts in succession will the effective discount be higher than 50%?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.7th
  • B.10th
  • C.8th
  • D.6th
Correct Answer: 8th

Let MP = 100

Price after 1st discount = 98

Price after 2nd discount = 94.08

Price after 3rd discount = 88.44

Price after 4th discount = 81.36

Price after 5th discount = 73.22

Price after 6th discount = 64.44

Price after 7th discount = 55.42

Price after 8th discount = 46.55

Thus, after 8th discount the effective discount will be more than 50%

Question 27
In the light of ‘Causation’ which of the following is incorrect? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Qualities of cause are accidental antecedents.B. The cause of the cause is not the same.C. The co-effects of a cause are themselves casually related.D. Eternal substance like space are not unconditional antecedents.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.A & D only
  • B.B & C only
  • C.C only
  • D.B & D only
Correct Answer: C only

Only statement C is incorrect.

Question 28
Identify the fallacy committed in the following argument: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)“There must be intelligent life on other planets. No one has proven, there isn’t”.
  • A.Appeal to ignorance
  • B.False alternative
  • C.Slippery slope
  • D.Hasty generalization
Correct Answer: Appeal to ignorance

Appeal to ignorance fallacy assumes that a statement is true simply because it hasn't been proven false.

The argument states, "There must be intelligent life on other planets" based solely on the fact that no one has proven otherwise. The lack of evidence for intelligent life doesn't automatically translate to its existence.

Question 29
When interference is based not on Causation but on Uniformity of co-existence in the case of the inferring cloven hoofs of an animal byit’shorns; it is called (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.PurvavatAnumnana
  • B.SesavatAnumnana
  • C.Samanyatodrsta
  • D.Paksadhmata
Correct Answer: Samanyatodrsta

The correct answer is option (C) - Samanyatodrsta.

 

Inference based on uniformity of co-existence: This refers to drawing a conclusion based on the consistent observation of two things appearing together, without necessarily implying a causal relationship.

 

The options:

(A) Purvavat Anumnana: This type of inference relies on previous observation of a causal relationship between two things.

(B) Sesavat Anumnana: This type of inference uses the absence of one thing to infer the absence of another, typically based on a causal relationship.

(C) Samanyatodrsta: This exactly matches the scenario described in the question. It infers a characteristic (cloven hoofs) based on the consistent observation of another characteristic (horns) in animals, without implying horns cause cloven hoofs.

(D) Paksadhmata: This refers to the flaw in an inference where the middle term (the reason for the inference) is not universally applicable to the subject.

Question 30
‘Sound is eternal because it is produced’ refers to which of the followingHetvabhasa? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Badhita
  • B.Virruddha
  • C.Asiddha
  • D.Savyabhichara
Correct Answer: Virruddha

Option B is the correct answer.

 

Viruddha: It is the contradictory middle. The middle term, instead of being pervaded by the presence of the major term, is pervaded by the absence of the major term. Instead of proving the existence of the major term in the minor term, it proves its non-existence therein; e.g., 'sound is eternal, because it is produced. Here ‘produced, instead of proving the eternality of sound, proves its non-eternality. Here the middle term itself disproves the original proposition and proves its contradictory, while in the savyabhichära the middle term only fails to prove the conclusion, and in the satpratipaksa the middle term is inferentially contradicted by another middle term both of which are of equal force, and in the bâdhita the middle term is non-inferentially contradicted and the major is disproved by a stronger pramäna other than inference.

Question 31
A smart home application that automates the controlling of lighting, temperature, entertainment systemand appliances is an example of:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Evolutionary computing
  • B.Nature-inspired computing
  • C.Bio-inspired computing
  • D.Ubiquitous computing
Correct Answer: Ubiquitous computing

Option D is correct.

Ubiquitous computing refers to the concept of integrating computing and communication capabilities seamlessly into everyday objects and environments, making them "smart" and interconnected. This enables these objects and environments to sense, interpret, and respond to human needs and preferences automatically.

A smart home application that automates the controlling of lighting, temperature, entertainment systems, and appliances exemplifies the principles of ubiquitous computing. By leveraging sensors, actuators, and networking technologies, such applications create an environment where various devices and systems work together intelligently to enhance convenience, comfort, and efficiency for users.

Question 32
Identify the correct order of the term A-E given below that completes the paragraph describing a method of operation for a keyboard (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A computer keyboard has a key matrix underneath the keys when a key is pressed, it presses a switch that completes a_________.This allows_____-to flow. The location of the key pressed is________. The location the key pressed is compared to a _______ map to find the ______ value for the key that has been pressed.A. BinaryB. CalculatedC. CharacterD. CircuitE. CurrentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.E, D, B, C, A
  • B.D, E, B, C, A
  • C.C, D, B, E, A
  • D.A, E, B, C, D
Correct Answer: D, E, B, C, A

When a key is pressed on a computer keyboard, it presses a switch that completes a circuit. This allows current to flow. The location of the key pressed is calculated. The location of the key pressed is compared to a character map to find the binary value for the key that has been pressed.

 

Therefore, the correct order is:

 

D. Circuit - completes a circuit

E. Current - allows current to flow

B. Calculated - the location of the key pressed is detected

C. Character - the location of the key pressed is compared to a character map

A. Binary - to find the binary value for the key that has been pressed

Question 33
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Internet is commonly used service on the World Wide Web.Statement II: HTTP is the protocol that web browsers and web servers use to communicate with each other over the internet.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the following options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. The Internet is not a service on the World Wide Web; rather, the World Wide Web is a service that operates over the Internet. The Internet encompasses a broader network infrastructure that includes various services beyond the World Wide Web, such as email, file transfer, and online gaming.

Statement II is true. HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is the protocol used for communication between web browsers and web servers on the World Wide Web. It facilitates the transmission of hypertext documents, enabling users to request and retrieve web pages from servers.

Question 34
Which of the following statements A-C are correct about Hard-Disk (HDD) used as single device in computer? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. It has no moving partsB. It is non-volatileC. It uses magnetic properties to store dataChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A & B only
  • B.A & C only
  • C.B & C only
  • D.A, B & C only
Correct Answer: B & C only

Option C is correct.

Statement A is incorrect. Traditional Hard Disk Drives (HDDs) do have moving parts, such as spinning platters and a mechanical arm with a read/write head. These components move to access and write data on the disk.

Statement B is correct. HDDs are non-volatile storage devices, meaning they retain data even when the power is turned off.

Statement C is also correct. HDDs use magnetic storage to store data. Each platter within an HDD is coated with a magnetic material, and data is stored by magnetizing specific regions of the disk surface.

Question 35
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I:10111012=1358Statement II:718=1110018In the light of the above statements choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

1358 = 5 × 80 + 3 × 81 + 1 × 82 = 93

10111012 = 1 × 20 + 0 × 21 + 1 × 22 + 1 × 23 + 1 × 24 + 0 × 25 + 1 × 26

= 64 + 16 + 8 + 4 + 1 = 93

 

Similarly we can calculate for Statement II.

 

We see that both the statements are correct.

Question 36
Secretaries of convention of Bio-diversity (CBD) is situated in(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Geneva, Switzerland
  • B.New York, United States
  • C.London, England
  • D.Montreal, Canada
Correct Answer: Montreal, Canada

The Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity (SCBD) is based in Montreal, Canada.

Question 37
Which of the following is included while estimating Air Quality Index (AQI)?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.N2O Nitrous Oxide
  • B.NO2Nitrogen dioxide
  • C.N2O3Dinitrogentrioxide
  • D.N2O5Dinitrogenpentoxide
Correct Answer: NO2Nitrogen dioxide

Option B is correct.

The Air Quality Index (AQI) is a numerical scale used to communicate the quality of the air in a specific location. It takes into account several pollutants commonly found in the air. Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) is one of the pollutants included in the calculation of the AQI.

Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) is a harmful gas emitted from vehicles, power plants, and industrial processes. It contributes to the formation of smog and can cause respiratory issues when present in high concentrations. Therefore, monitoring NO2 levels is important for assessing air quality and determining the AQI.

Question 38
Which among the following are Natural Green House Gases (GHGs)? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. CO2(Carbon dioxide)B. H2O (water vapor)C. CH4(Methane)D. O3(Ozone)E. CFC (Chlorofluorocarbon)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D only.
  • B.A, C, D, E only.
  • C.B, C, D, E only.
  • D.A, B, C, E only.
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D only.

Option A is correct.

Natural greenhouse gases (GHGs) are those that occur naturally in the Earth's atmosphere and contribute to the greenhouse effect. They trap heat from the sun and warm the Earth's surface, helping to maintain a habitable climate.

CO2 (Carbon dioxide): Carbon dioxide is one of the most abundant greenhouse gases in the atmosphere and is naturally produced through processes such as respiration, volcanic eruptions, and decomposition.

H2O (Water vapor): Water vapor is the most abundant greenhouse gas in the atmosphere and is naturally present as water evaporates from oceans, lakes, rivers, and other bodies of water.

CH4 (Methane): Methane is another significant greenhouse gas that occurs naturally through processes such as anaerobic decomposition in wetlands, enteric fermentation in animals, and the decay of organic matter.

O3 (Ozone): Ozone is a natural greenhouse gas found in the Earth's stratosphere, where it plays a crucial role in absorbing ultraviolet radiation from the sun. However, at ground level, ozone is considered a pollutant and is not typically considered a greenhouse gas in the context of the Earth's atmosphere.

CFC (Chlorofluorocarbon), is not a natural greenhouse gas. CFCs are synthetic compounds used in refrigeration, air conditioning, and aerosol propellants. While they are potent greenhouse gases, they are not naturally occurring and are primarily the result of human activities.

Question 39
Carbon monoxide, an air pollutant when inhaled readily binds with the hemoglobin in the bloodstream to form a life-threatening compound known as(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Hemoglobous
  • B.Carbohemoglobin
  • C.Carbon mono hemoglobin
  • D.Carboxyhemoglobin
Correct Answer: Carboxyhemoglobin

Option D is correct.

When carbon monoxide (CO), an air pollutant, is inhaled, it readily binds with hemoglobin in the bloodstream. Hemoglobin is the protein in red blood cells responsible for transporting oxygen from the lungs to the rest of the body. When CO binds with hemoglobin, it forms a compound called carboxyhemoglobin.

Carboxy hemoglobin is a stable complex that is unable to transport oxygen effectively. As a result, the oxygen-carrying capacity of the blood decreases, leading to hypoxia (a deficiency in the amount of oxygen reaching the tissues). This can be life-threatening, especially if levels of carboxy hemoglobin become elevated.

Question 40
Which of the following is a chemical treatment in water treatment process?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Filtration
  • B.Sedimentation
  • C.Coagulation
  • D.Screening
Correct Answer: Coagulation

Option C is correct.

Coagulation is a chemical treatment method used in the water treatment process.

Filtration is a physical treatment process that involves passing water through a filter medium to remove suspended particles, sediment, and other impurities.

Sedimentation is also a physical treatment process where suspended solids in water settle out due to gravity, forming a sediment layer at the bottom of a settling basin or tank.

Coagulation is a chemical treatment process where coagulants, such as aluminum sulfate (alum) or ferric chloride, are added to water. These chemicals cause small suspended particles to clump together and form larger, heavier particles called flocs. This process facilitates the removal of suspended solids, turbidity, and other impurities during subsequent sedimentation and filtration stages.

Screening is a mechanical treatment process that involves passing water through screens or meshes to remove large debris, such as leaves, twigs, and larger particles, from the water stream.

Question 41
In the beginning of the 20th century in 1902, there were important engineering colleges at(a)Roorkee(b) Madras(c) Kanpur(d)Sibpur(Bengal)(e) PoonaChoose the correct answer from the options given below.
  • A.a, b, d only
  • B.a, b, d & e only
  • C.a, b, c & e only
  • D.d only
Correct Answer: a, b, d & e only

The College of Engineering, Guindy (CEG) in Chennai, India, is an engineering and technical institution and was established in 1794.

 

Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (commonly known as IIT Roorkee or IITR), formerly the University of Roorkee (1948–2001), the Thomason College of Civil Engineering (1853–1948), College of Civil Engineering at Roorkee (1847–1853) is a public university located in Roorkee, Uttarakhand, India.

 

College of Engineering, Pune COEP’s precursor, The Poona Engineering Class and Mechanical School was opened in July 1854, with an aim to provide suitable learning to the subordinate officers in the Public Works Department.

 

Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology, Shibpur, IIEST, Shibpur is one of the oldest engineering institutes in India, established as the Calcutta Civil Engineering College in 1856. In 1880, the institute is shifted to its present campus at Shibpur, Howrah, in the premises of Bishop’s College.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option B.

Question 42
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: The NEP 2020 recommends the establishment of an academic bank of credit to facilitate the transfer of credits between the institutions.Statement II: One of the objectives of NEP 2020 is to increase the number of multi-disciplinary institutions in the country.
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Following are the key features of NEP 2020 with respect to Higher Education:

Gross Enrolment Ratio in higher education to be raised to 50% by 2035. Also, 3.5 crore seats to be added in higher education. The current Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in higher education is 26.3%.

Holistic Undergraduate education with a flexible curriculum can be of 3 or 4 years with multiple exit options and appropriate certification within this period.

M. Phil courses will be discontinued and all the courses at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD level will now be interdisciplinary.

Academic Bank of Credits to be established to facilitate Transfer of Credits.

Multidisciplinary Education and Research Universities (MERUs), at par with IITs, IIMs, to be set up as models of best multidisciplinary education of global standards in the country.

The National Research Foundation will be created as an apex body for fostering a strong research culture and building research capacity across higher education.

Higher Education Commission of India (HECI) will be set up as a single umbrella body for the entire higher education, excluding medical and legal education. Public and private higher education institutions will be governed by the same set of norms for regulation, accreditation and academic standards. Also, HECI will be having 4 independent verticals namely,

National Higher Education Regulatory Council (NHERC) for regulation,

General Education Council (GEC) for standard setting,

Higher Education Grants Council (HEGC) for funding,

National Accreditation Council (NAC) for accreditation.

Affiliation of colleges is to be phased out in 15 years and a stage-wise mechanism to be established for granting graded autonomy to colleges. Over a period of time, every college is expected to develop into either an autonomous degree-granting College, or a constituent college of a university.

 

Thus, both statement I and II are correct.

Question 43
‘We become builders by building and we become just’ by doing what is just in the light of this statement what cannot be asserted? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Man is a virtuous being
  • B.Virtues are like hell
  • C.Skills are acquired by performing relevant activity
  • D.Virtue is a mechanical and non-mechanical skill
Correct Answer: Virtue is a mechanical and non-mechanical skill

The correct answer is option D.

Question 44
In the light of Buddhist system of education, student we expected to follow ‘DasSikhaPadani’. (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Which of the following does not represent the code of conduct:-A. To avoid food at odd timesB. To avoid untrue speechC. To relish music and danceD. To avoid stealingE. To accept gifts in charityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A & B
  • B.B & C
  • C.C & D
  • D.C & E
Correct Answer: C & E

In the realm of Buddhist system of education, the 10 orders were known as ‘Das Sikha Padani’. Each student had to follow them. These ten orders were:

1. Not to do creature violence.

2. Not to take anyone’s material.

3. Keep away from impure behaviour.

4. Not to speak untrue things.

5. Not to consume intoxicating elements.

6. Not to eat food at the wrong time.

7. Not to condemn anyone.

8. Keep away from singing and dancing.

9. Not to use fragrant and make up things.

10. Never to accept alms of silver-gold expensive objects.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option D.

Question 45
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: University of Punjab at Lahore and University of Allahabad were established during colonial rule in India.Statement II: The main reason of their establishment was the increasing demand in these places for higher education including “Oriental” as well as Modern European education.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Statement I: The University of Punjab at Lahore was set up on October 14, 1882. The Allahabad University was established on November 16, 1889. Therefore, statement I is correct.

Statement I:This statement is also true. During the colonial period, there was a growing demand for higher education in various regions of India, including Punjab and Allahabad. The establishment of universities like Punjab University and Allahabad University aimed to meet this demand by providing education in both traditional "Oriental" subjects as well as modern European disciplines. These universities served as centers for higher learning and intellectual exchange during the colonial era.

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Given the precarious condition of its ground and surface water resources (rivers, stream, lakes, wetlands and reservoirs). India could be water-scarce country in the next 40 years. With 1.486 cubic meters (~1.5 million litres) of water available per person.perannum. India falls in the water stressed category. A dip below 1000 cubic meters per person, per annum will push it into the water-scarce category.The manner of water consumption also compounds the problem. Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) statistics show the indiscriminate use of ground water turned 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country critical in 2022 while 14% were assessed as over-exploited. The situation was worse in 2017 when 17% of the units were over-exploited. Various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit but the number of such units remain high in states like Punjab, Rajasthan,Haryana. Delhi, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.In India,87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation and experts say excess withdrawal round the year may be the biggest reason for depletion, as the recharge primarily happens in the monsoon. On the other hand encroachment of water bodies and the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams have reduced the surface water resources.India will become water-scarce country if the availability of water per person per annum fallsbelow:
  • A.~ 1 millionlitre
  • B.~ 1.5 millionlitre
  • C.~ 1.2 millionlitre
  • D.~ 100000litre
Correct Answer: ~ 1 millionlitre

The passage states that a dip below 1000 cubic meters per person per annum will push India into the water-scarce category. One cubic meter is equivalent to 1000 litres. Therefore, 1000 cubic meters is equal to 1,000,000 litres.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Given the precarious condition of its ground and surface water resources (rivers, stream, lakes, wetlands and reservoirs). India could be water-scarce country in the next 40 years. With 1.486 cubic meters (~1.5 million litres) of water available per person.perannum. India falls in the water stressed category. A dip below 1000 cubic meters per person, per annum will push it into the water-scarce category.The manner of water consumption also compounds the problem. Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) statistics show the indiscriminate use of ground water turned 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country critical in 2022 while 14% were assessed as over-exploited. The situation was worse in 2017 when 17% of the units were over-exploited. Various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit but the number of such units remain high in states like Punjab, Rajasthan,Haryana. Delhi, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.In India,87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation and experts say excess withdrawal round the year may be the biggest reason for depletion, as the recharge primarily happens in the monsoon. On the other hand encroachment of water bodies and the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams have reduced the surface water resources.In the year 2022 how many units of water assessed by CGWB were found to be overexploited?
  • A.~ 283
  • B.~ 992
  • C.~ 1276
  • D.~ 1006
Correct Answer: ~ 992

The passage states that in 2022, 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country were classified as critical, and 14% were assessed as over-exploited. To find the number of units overexploited in 2022, we calculate 14% of 7,089:

14/100 × 7,089 = = 992.46

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Given the precarious condition of its ground and surface water resources (rivers, stream, lakes, wetlands and reservoirs). India could be water-scarce country in the next 40 years. With 1.486 cubic meters (~1.5 million litres) of water available per person.perannum. India falls in the water stressed category. A dip below 1000 cubic meters per person, per annum will push it into the water-scarce category.The manner of water consumption also compounds the problem. Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) statistics show the indiscriminate use of ground water turned 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country critical in 2022 while 14% were assessed as over-exploited. The situation was worse in 2017 when 17% of the units were over-exploited. Various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit but the number of such units remain high in states like Punjab, Rajasthan,Haryana. Delhi, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.In India,87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation and experts say excess withdrawal round the year may be the biggest reason for depletion, as the recharge primarily happens in the monsoon. On the other hand encroachment of water bodies and the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams have reduced the surface water resources.Assuming that the total number of ground water units assessed by CWGB in the years 2017and2022 were same (i.e. 7089). What is the difference between the number of over-exploited units in 2017 and 2022?
  • A.~213
  • B.~216
  • C.~260
  • D.~354
Correct Answer: ~213

To find the difference between the number of over-exploited units in 2017 and 2022, we first need to calculate the number of over-exploited units for each year based on the given percentages.

 

In 2017:

17% of 7,089 units were over-exploited.

 

17/100 × 7,089 = 1,205.13

 

In 2022:

14% of 7,089 units were over-exploited.

 

14/100 × 7,089 = 992.46

 

Difference = Number of over-exploited units in 2017 - Number of over-exploited units in 2022

Difference = 1,205.13 – 992.46

Difference = 212.67

 

Therefore, the approximate difference between the number of over-exploited units in 2017 and 2022 is ~213.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Given the precarious condition of its ground and surface water resources (rivers, stream, lakes, wetlands and reservoirs). India could be water-scarce country in the next 40 years. With 1.486 cubic meters (~1.5 million litres) of water available per person.perannum. India falls in the water stressed category. A dip below 1000 cubic meters per person, per annum will push it into the water-scarce category.The manner of water consumption also compounds the problem. Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) statistics show the indiscriminate use of ground water turned 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country critical in 2022 while 14% were assessed as over-exploited. The situation was worse in 2017 when 17% of the units were over-exploited. Various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit but the number of such units remain high in states like Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.In India,87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation and experts say excess withdrawal round the year may be the biggest reason for depletion, as the recharge primarily happens in the monsoon. On the other hand encroachment of water bodies and the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams have reduced the surface water resources.Which of the following states have been found to have high number of over exploited units ofgroundwater?A. Rajasthan and DelhiB. Punjab & HaryanaC. Uttar PradeshD. Tamil Nadu & KarnatakaE. Madhya PradeshChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C & D only
  • B.A, B & D only
  • C.B, C, D & E only
  • D.A. B, C, D, E
Correct Answer: A, B & D only

The passage mentions that various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit, but the number of critical and over-exploited units of groundwater remains high in certain states, including Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Given the precarious condition of its ground and surface water resources (rivers, stream, lakes, wetlands and reservoirs). India could be water-scarce country in the next 40 years. With 1.486 cubic meters (~1.5 million litres) of water available per person.perannum. India falls in the water stressed category. A dip below 1000 cubic meters per person, per annum will push it into the water-scarce category.The manner of water consumption also compounds the problem. Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) statistics show the indiscriminate use of ground water turned 4% of the total 7,089 assessed units in the country critical in 2022 while 14% were assessed as over-exploited. The situation was worse in 2017 when 17% of the units were over-exploited. Various recharge and conservation efforts have borne fruit but the number of such units remain high in states like Punjab, Rajasthan,Haryana. Delhi, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.In India,87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation and experts say excess withdrawal round the year may be the biggest reason for depletion, as the recharge primarily happens in the monsoon. On the other hand encroachment of water bodies and the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams have reduced the surface water resources.Identify the factors responsible for depletion of water resources.A. High consumption of water in agricultural sectorB. High consumption of water in Commercial sectorC. Encroachment of water bodiesD. Excessive water use in domestic sectorE. Discharge of untreated waste water in rivers and streams.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C, D & E only
  • B.A, B, C & E only
  • C.A, B, C, D, E
  • D.A. C & E only
Correct Answer: A. C & E only

The factors responsible for the depletion of water resources mentioned in the passage are:

 

A. High consumption of water in agricultural sector: The passage mentions that 87% of groundwater is extracted for irrigation, indicating high water consumption in the agricultural sector.

 

C. Encroachment of water bodies: The passage states that encroachment of water bodies contributes to the reduction of surface water resources.

 

E. Discharge of untreated waste water in rivers and streams: The passage mentions that the discharge of untreated waste water into rivers and streams has reduced surface water resources.

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Quiz Attempt #119745

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage distribution of five different Models (A-E) of Mobile Phones produced by a company during the years 2021 and 2022. Total number of Mobile Phones produced by the company in 2021 and 2022 is 4,50,000and 5,20,000.Year-wise Percentage (%) Distribution of Model of Mobile PhonesModel/YearABCDE202115%25%30%10%20%202210%30%25%25%10%Question: What is the difference between the number of Model – C Mobile phones produced by the company in the year 2021 and 2022?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.5000
  • B.7500
  • C.10000
  • D.2500
Correct Answer: 5000

Required difference = 30% of 450000 – 25% of 520000

= 135000 – 130000

= 5000

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage distribution of five different Models (A-E) of Mobile Phones produced by a company during the years 2021 and 2022. Total number of Mobile Phones produced by the company in 2021 and 2022 is 4,50,000and 5,20,000.Year-wise Percentage (%) Distribution of Model of Mobile PhonesModel/YearABCDE202115%25%30%10%20%202210%30%25%25%10%Question: If 85% of the number of Model-E Mobile phones produced by the company during 2021 and 2022 were sold, then how many Model-E Mobile phones were left unsold by the company?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.142800
  • B.21300
  • C.29100
  • D.25200
Correct Answer: 21300

Number of Model – E phones produced by company = 20% of 450000 + 10% of 520000

= 142000

Mobile phones that remained unsold = 142000 × 0.15 = 21300

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage distribution of five different Models (A-E) of Mobile Phones produced by a company during the years 2021 and 2022. Total number of Mobile Phones produced by the company in 2021 and 2022 is 4,50,000and 5,20,000.Year-wise Percentage (%) Distribution of Model of Mobile PhonesModel/YearABCDE202115%25%30%10%20%202210%30%25%25%10%Question: If the number of Model-A Mobile phones produced by the company in 2022 was the same as that in 2021, then what would have been its approximate percentage share in the total production of 2022?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.11%
  • B.13%
  • C.15%
  • D.9%
Correct Answer: 13%

Model A mobiles produced in 2021 = 15% of 450000 = 67500

Percentage share of Model A in the total production of 2022 = 67500520000 × 100 ≈ 13%

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage distribution of five different Models (A-E) of Mobile Phones produced by a company during the years 2021 and 2022. Total number of Mobile Phones produced by the company in 2021 and 2022 is 4,50,000and 5,20,000.Year-wise Percentage (%) Distribution of Model of Mobile PhonesModel/YearABCDE202115%25%30%10%20%202210%30%25%25%10%Question: The number of Mobile phones of Model – B in the year 2022 is approximately _______ % more than the number of Model-D Mobile phones in the year 2021.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.240
  • B.92
  • C.128
  • D.247
Correct Answer: 247

Required Percentage = 30% of 520000-10% of 45000010% of 450000 × 100 = 246.67% ≈ 247%

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage distribution of five different Models (A-E) of Mobile Phones produced by a company during the years 2021 and 2022.
