Total number of Mobile Phones produced by the company in 2021 and 2022 is 4,50,000and 5,20,000.Year-wise Percentage (%) Distribution of Model of Mobile PhonesModel/YearABCDE202115%25%30%10%20%202210%30%25%25%10%Question: What is the ratio of the number of Mobile phones of Model-C, D and E in the year 2022 to the number of Mobile phones of Model-B, C and D in the year 2021?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.18:17
  • B.25:19
  • C.16:15
  • D.14:15
Correct Answer: 16:15

Required ratio = 25+25+10% of 52000030+25+10% of 450000 = 16 : 15

Question 6
If Ram is not able to understand certain concept in a particular subject and its continuously performing poorly in that subject, which evaluation test will have to be conducted to know the cause of his difficulties?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Placement Evaluation
  • B.Diagnostic Evaluation
  • C.Summative Evaluation
  • D.Formative Evaluation
Correct Answer: Diagnostic Evaluation

Diagnostic evaluation is used to identify the specific areas of weakness or difficulty that a student may be experiencing. It helps educators understand the root cause of the problem by diagnosing the student's strengths and weaknesses in relation to a particular subject or concept. In Ram's case, a diagnostic evaluation would help pinpoint the specific areas where he is struggling and provide insights into the reasons behind his poor performance in that subject. This information can then be used to tailor instructional strategies and interventions to address his individual learning needs.

Question 7
Which of the following levels of teaching involves the highest order thinking skills?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Memory level
  • B.Understanding level
  • C.Reflective level
  • D.All levels involve similar thinking skills
Correct Answer: Reflective level

Reflective level teaching involves critical thinking, analysis, evaluation, and synthesis of information. At this level, students are not only required to understand and remember concepts but also to critically examine and analyze them, make connections between different ideas, evaluate arguments and evidence, and generate new insights or perspectives. Reflective level thinking goes beyond simply understanding and recalling information, requiring students to engage in higher-order cognitive processes.

Question 8
Which of the following are the online tools used for creating and sharing mind maps?A.CoogleB.FlipgridC.MindmesiterD. Google formsE.MiroChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, C & E only
  • B.B, D & E only
  • C.A & C only
  • D.B & D only
Correct Answer: A, C & E only

Coogle (option A) is not a known online tool for creating and sharing mind maps.

Flipgrid (option B) is primarily used for video discussions and not for creating mind maps.

Mindmeister (option C) is a popular online tool specifically designed for creating and sharing mind maps.

Google Forms (option D) is used for creating surveys and forms, not mind maps.

Miro (option E) is an online collaborative whiteboarding platform that can be used for creating and sharing mind maps among other things.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct

Question 9
Which of the following is an example of an inclusive learning environment? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A classroom where students are expected to conform to strict set of rules and regulations
  • B.A classroom where only students of a certain ethnicity are allowed to participate in class discussion
  • C.A classroom where students are discouraged from asking questions or challenging the teachers authority
  • D.A classroom where all the students are encouraged to share their unique experiences and perspectives
Correct Answer: A classroom where all the students are encouraged to share their unique experiences and perspectives

An inclusive learning environment promotes diversity, equity, and belonging for all students. Option (D) describes a classroom where students are encouraged to share their unique experiences and perspectives. In such an environment, students feel valued, respected, and supported regardless of their background, abilities, or identities. Encouraging students to share their diverse perspectives fosters collaboration, critical thinking, and empathy among peers, enriching the learning experience for everyone.

Question 10
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Teaching at the understanding level involves encouraging students to think critically and reflect on their learning experiences.Statement II: Teaching at the memory level involves rote mobilization and does not encourage critical thinking.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Statement I is false. Teaching at the reflective level involves encouraging students to think critically and reflect on their learning experiences.

 

Statement II is true. Teaching at the memory level typically focuses on rote memorization of facts and information, without necessarily encouraging deeper understanding or critical thinking.

 

Therefore, option (D) is correct.

Question 11
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: In observational research the variables are actively manipulated and the environment is as controlled as possible.Statement II: Observational Research allows you to eliminate the influence of many extraneous factors.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

Option B is correct.

Statement I is incorrect. In observational research, variables are not manipulated by the researcher; instead, they are observed as they occur naturally. Observational research aims to observe and describe phenomena as they exist in their natural settings without any intervention or manipulation by the researcher. Therefore, the statement is false.

Statement II is also incorrect. Observational research often deals with real-life situations where numerous extraneous factors can influence the observed phenomena. Unlike experimental research where extraneous factors can be controlled or manipulated, observational research lacks such control, making it difficult to eliminate the influence of extraneous factors completely. Therefore, the statement is false.

Question 12
When the researchers sex affect the behavior of a participant in a study, it refers to(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Psychosocial effect
  • B.Psychological effect
  • C.Biosocial effect
  • D.Environmental effect
Correct Answer: Biosocial effect

Option C is correct.

When the researcher's sex (gender) affects the behavior of a participant in a study, it refers to a biosocial effect. Biosocial factors encompass both biological (bio) and social (social) aspects that influence human behavior and interactions.

In this scenario, the sex of the researcher is a social factor that interacts with the biological and social factors of the participant, leading to an effect on the participant's behavior. This effect can stem from various factors such as cultural norms, societal expectations, comfort levels, or biases associated with interactions between individuals of different sexes.

Question 13
Arrange the following sales of measurement from the simplest to the most evolvedA. OrdinalB. NominalC. RatioD. IntervalChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, C, A, D
  • C.C, D, B, A
  • D.B, A, D, C
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

The correct answer is option (D), i.e., B, A, D, C.

 

Nominal: This is the simplest level of measurement, where data is categorized into distinct categories with no inherent order or ranking.

Ordinal: In this level, data is categorized into distinct categories like nominal data, but there's an inherent order or ranking among the categories.

Interval: This level includes all the characteristics of ordinal data, but with equal intervals between the points on the scale. However, it lacks a true zero point.

Ratio: This is the most evolved level of measurement, possessing all the characteristics of nominal, ordinal, and interval data, but it also has a true zero point, allowing for ratios to be calculated.

Question 14
When studies on a given topic lead to similar conclusions, the measurements show(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Convergent Validity
  • B.Criterion Validity
  • C.Divergent Validity
  • D.Construct Validity
Correct Answer: Convergent Validity

Convergent validity refers to the degree to which different measures of the same construct are correlated with each other. When studies on a given topic lead to similar conclusions, it indicates that different measures of the construct are converging or agreeing with each other, thus demonstrating convergent validity.

Question 15
Which of the following p-values would signify that a sample correlation coefficient is significant at 1% level of significance?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.0.005
  • B.0.02
  • C.0.99
  • D.0.95
Correct Answer: 0.005

Option A is correct.

In hypothesis testing, the p-value represents the probability of obtaining the observed results (or more extreme results) if the null hypothesis is true. When conducting a hypothesis test for correlation coefficients, a low p-value indicates strong evidence against the null hypothesis, suggesting that there is a significant correlation in the population.

 

In this case, the significance level (alpha, denoted by α) is 1%, which means that we are willing to accept a 1% chance of making a Type I error (rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true). Therefore, if the p-value is less than 0.01 (1%), we reject the null hypothesis and conclude that the correlation coefficient is statistically significant at the 1% level of significance.

0.005 is less than 0.01, so it signifies statistical significance at the 1% level.

0.02 is greater than 0.01, so it does not signify statistical significance at the 1% level.

0.99 is much greater than 0.01, so it does not signify statistical significance at the 1% level.

0.95 is greater than 0.01, so it does not signify statistical significance at the 1% level.

Question 16
Soaps, sit-coms and comics are part of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.High-brow culture
  • B.Middle-brow culture
  • C.Restrictive culture
  • D.Popular culture
Correct Answer: Popular culture

Soaps, sitcoms (situational comedies), and comics are typically considered part of popular culture, which refers to culture based on the tastes of ordinary people rather than an educated elite. Pop culture is manifested around the world through movies, music, television shows, newspapers, satellite broadcasts, fast food and clothing, among other entertainment of consumer goods.

Question 17
The first highway of information is(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Newssheets
  • B.Telegraph
  • C.Films
  • D.Internet
Correct Answer: Telegraph

The telegraph is considered the first highway of information because it revolutionized communication by enabling the rapid transmission of messages over long distances. The telegraph allowed people to send coded electrical signals through wires, making it possible to communicate almost instantaneously across vast distances. The telegraph played a crucial role in shaping the modern world by facilitating faster and more efficient communication on a global scale.

Question 18
The main function of mass media are to: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Make a society staticB. InformC. EducateD. PersuadeE. EntertainChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.A, C, E only
  • C.B, C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, D only
Correct Answer: B, C, D, E only

Mass media serves multiple functions, including informing, educating, persuading, and entertaining. It does not aim to make society static. Thus option (C) is the correct answer.

Question 19
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: The digital technology has enabled increase in media consumption.Statement II: Analog media are superior in quality, but do not have popular demand.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Statement I is true because digital technology has enabled an increase in media consumption due to its accessibility and convenience. However, Statement II is false because analog media may have certain qualities, but they are not inherently superior in quality, and they may still have popular demand in specific contexts.

Question 20
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Communication can be a path to seek truth.Statement II: Communication can also be used to suppress truth.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Statement I is true because communication, when used properly, can facilitate the discovery and dissemination of truth. Statement II is also true because communication can be manipulated or used to withhold or distort truth, leading to its suppression.

Question 21
What number would replace question mark (?) in the series given below? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)11, 13, 17, 19, 23, ?, 31, 37
  • A.28
  • B.25
  • C.27
  • D.29
Correct Answer: 29

The given series is a series of prime numbers. Next prime number will be 29.

Question 22
The present age of the father of a boy is twice the age of the boy. Six years later the ratio of their ages will be 11:6. Find the present age the boy?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.30 years
  • B.28 years
  • C.25 years
  • D.23 years
Correct Answer: 30 years

Let present age of boy = x

Present age of father = 2x

After 6 years,

2x+6x+6 = 116

or x = 30

Thus, present age of boy = 30 years.

Question 23
An amount ofRs. 2040 is to be divided among three friends x, y and z. The friend z is to be given 2/3rd of what y has to be given and y has to be given 1/4th of that of x. How much money will y receive?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 360
  • B.Rs. 1440
  • C.Rs. 240
  • D.Rs. 600
Correct Answer: Rs. 360

Let x gets Rs. m.

Then y will ger Rs. m4 and z will get 23 of m4 = m6

Now, m + m4 + m6 = 2040

or m = 1440

y will get 14404 = Rs. 360

Question 24
If in a certain coding language. PAINT is coded as 93546 and EXCEL is coded as 78271.thenhow will ACCEPT be coded in that language?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.322769
  • B.322976
  • C.232796
  • D.322796
Correct Answer: 322796

The code for ACCEPT will be 322796.

Question 25
A sum of money doubles in 14 years. In how many years would it triple if the rate of interest is considered as simple?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.25 years
  • B.28 years
  • C.18 years
  • D.23 years
Correct Answer: 28 years

Let P, R and T be the Principal, rate of interest and time respectively.

So, P = P×R×14100

or R = 10014 = 507%

Let after x years, the money will be triple.

Then, 2P = P×507×x100

or x = 28

Thus , the money will be triple after 28 years.

Question 26
Identify the common pattern of deductive reasoning in the following argument:“If we don’t stop for gas soon, then we will run out of gas. If we run out of gas, then we will be late for the wedding. Therefore, if we don’t stop for gas soon we will be late for wedding.” (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Denying the consequent
  • B.Affirming the consequent
  • C.Denying the antecedent
  • D.Chain argument
Correct Answer: Chain argument

Option D is correct.

Chain argument: This type of argument connects multiple conditional statements (if...then...) to reach a conclusion. The conclusion follows logically from the chain of interconnected premises.

Question 27
Match List I with the List II.LIST I (Hetvabhasa)LIST II (Example)A.AshraysiddhaI. Sound is eternal because it is audibleB.VyaptatvasiddhaII. Sly lotus is fragrant because it is a lotus like the lotus of the lakeC.SvarupsiddhaIII. Wherever there is fire there is smokeD.AsadharanaSavyabhicharaIV. Sound is a quality because it is visibleChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
  • B.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(III), B-(II), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)

Option D is the correct answer.

 

D. Asadharana Savyabhichara – I. Sound is eternal because it is audible

A. Ashraysiddha – II. Sly lotus is fragrant because it is a lotus like the lotus of the lake

B. Vyaptatvasiddha – III. Wherever there is fire there is smoke

C. Svarupsiddha – IV. Sound is a quality because it is visible

Question 28
Observe the following argument and pick the correct answer:“All pigs are sheepAll sheep are goatTherefore, all pigs are goats”A. A valid argument because if the premises were true the conclusion would have been true.B. An invalid argument because the conclusion does not follow from the premises.C. The conclusion is probably true.D. It is weak argument.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A only
  • B.B &Donly
  • C.C & D only
  • D.D only
Correct Answer: A only

Option A is correct. It means a valid argument because if the premises were true the conclusion would have been true.

Question 29
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason R.Assertion A:Atyantabhavais eternal.Reason R: If a particular thing does not exist in a particular locust at any times, then it is said that there isAtyantabhavaof that thing.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is true but R is false
  • D.A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A

The correct answer is option (A) - Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.

 

Assertion (A): Atyantabhava is eternal.

This statement is correct. Atyantabhava, a term in Indian logic, refers to the absolute non-existence of something at all times (past, present, future). Since absolute non-existence is a fundamental concept, it can be considered eternal.

 

Reason (R): If a particular thing does not exist in a particular locus at any times, then it is said that there is Atyantabhava of that thing.

This statement is also correct. It explains the concept of Atyantabhava by stating that the complete absence of something in a place (locus) across all time points qualifies as Atyantabhava.

 

Connection between A and R:

Reason (R) directly explains the concept of Atyantabhava mentioned in Assertion (A). It clarifies that Atyantabhava refers to the absolute and enduring absence of something.

 

Therefore, both A and R are true, and R accurately explains the concept behind A.

Question 30
‘Fire is cold because it is a substance’ represents which of the followingHetvabhasa? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Viruddha
  • B.Badhita
  • C.Asiddha
  • D.Savyabhichara
Correct Answer: Badhita

Bâdhita is the non-inferentially contradicted middle. Here the middle term is contradicted by some other pramäna and not by inference. It cannot prove the major term which is disproved by another stronger source of valid knowledge; e.g., 'fire is cold, because it is a substance'. Here the middle term 'substance becomes contradicted because its major term ‘coldness is directly contradicted by perception.

Question 31
Computers have evolved from the early mainframe computers to the relatively small smart devices with high computing power being us today. Which of the following inventions contributed to reduce the physical size of computers?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Vacuum Tubes
  • B.Transistors
  • C.Integrated circuits
  • D.Cathode Ray Tube
Correct Answer: Integrated circuits

Option C is correct.

Integrated circuits (ICs) revolutionized the field of computing by enabling the miniaturization of electronic components. Unlike earlier technologies such as vacuum tubes and transistors, which were bulky and required significant physical space, integrated circuits allowed multiple electronic components (such as transistors, resistors, and capacitors) to be fabricated on a single silicon chip.

The invention of integrated circuits by Jack Kilby and Robert Noyce in the late 1950s and early 1960s marked a significant advancement in computer technology. By integrating multiple electronic components onto a single chip, integrated circuits greatly reduced the physical size of computers while simultaneously increasing their computing power and efficiency.

Therefore, integrated circuits played a crucial role in reducing the physical size of computers, enabling the development of smaller and more powerful devices such as smartphones, tablets, and laptops.

Question 32
Consider two binary numbers P= 10110001 and Q= 01001110. If X=P or Q and Y=P and Q, then what will be the values of X and Y respectively? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.01001110,10110001
  • B.10110001,00000000
  • C.10110001,11111111
  • D.11111111,00000000
Correct Answer: 11111111,00000000

To find the values of X and Y given binary numbers we'll perform bitwise OR and bitwise AND operations.

 

Bitwise OR (denoted by ∨) operates on corresponding bits of the two binary numbers, setting a bit in the result if either of the corresponding bits in the operands is 1.

 

Bitwise AND (denoted by ∧) operates on corresponding bits of the two binary numbers, setting a bit in the result only if both of the corresponding bits in the operands are 1.

Thus, correct answer is X = 11111111

And Y = 00000000

Question 33
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Using 3D printers, prosthetic limbs can be made to exactly fit the recipientStatement II: OLEDs consume more power than LCD/LED formats and thus produce more heat.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. 3D printing technology allows for the creation of custom-fitted prosthetic limbs. By utilizing 3D scanning technology to capture precise measurements of the recipient's anatomy and then using 3D printers to manufacture the prosthetic limb accordingly, it is indeed possible to create prosthetics that fit the recipient's unique body shape and size. Therefore, Statement I is true.

Statement II is false. OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) displays typically consume less power compared to traditional LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) or LED (Light-Emitting Diode) displays. OLED technology allows for individual pixels to emit light, eliminating the need for a separate backlight found in LCD displays. This results in potentially lower power consumption for OLED displays. Additionally, OLEDs are known for their energy efficiency and ability to produce less heat compared to traditional displays. Therefore, Statement II is false.

Question 34
Which of the following statements are valid? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Providing the personal informationpfcustomers stored in a computer to an insurance agent by the vehicle servicing center in an issue related to the privacy of customerB. Providing a copy of a single-user licensed software to another party is a privacy issue related to the ownership of the software.C. Unauthorized access to another person’s computer is both illegal and ethicalD. The right to use a piece of software is termed as a copyrightChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A & D only
  • B.B & C only
  • C.B & D only
  • D.A, B & C only
Correct Answer: A, B & C only

Option D is correct.

Providing the personal information of customers stored in a computer to an insurance agent by the vehicle servicing center is an issue related to the privacy of customers. This action may raise concerns about how personal data is handled and shared, potentially violating privacy regulations or policies.

Providing a copy of a single-user licensed software to another party is indeed a privacy issue related to the ownership of the software. This action violates the terms of the software license agreement and infringes upon the rights of the software developer or owner, impacting the ownership and distribution of the software.

Unauthorized access to another person’s computer is both illegal and unethical. It violates laws related to computer security and privacy, such as hacking or unauthorized access statutes. Additionally, it breaches ethical principles regarding respect for others' privacy and property.

The statement "The right to use a piece of software is termed as a copyright" is incorrect. Copyright refers to the legal protection granted to creators of original works, including software, which gives them the exclusive right to reproduce, distribute, and modify their work. The right to use a piece of software is typically referred to as a software license, not a copyright.

Question 35
Match List I with the List II.LIST I (Internet Term)LIST II (DESCRIPTION)A. BrowserI. Protocol that is used to send data for web pages across the internetB. HTTPSII. A text-file (stored by web browser) that contains data about a user’s browsing preferencesC. URLIII. Software that allows users to view web pageD. CookieIV. A text-based version of web addressChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A-(II), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(III)
  • B.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • C.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

Option D is correct.

A browser is software that allows users to access and view web pages on the internet.

HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is a protocol used to securely transmit data, including web pages, over the internet.

URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is a text-based address used to locate resources such as web pages on the internet.

A cookie is a small text file stored by a web browser on a user's device that contains data about the user's browsing preferences and activity on a website.

Question 36
Air Quality Index (AQI) is represented in(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Unit of
  • B.Unit of ppm
  • C.Percentage (%)
  • D.Numbers
Correct Answer: Numbers

Option D is correct.

The Air Quality Index (AQI) is a numerical scale used to measure and communicate the quality of the air in a particular area. It provides information about the level of pollution and its potential impact on health. The AQI is typically represented as a numerical value, ranging from 0 to 500 or sometimes even higher, depending on the specific scale used in different countries.

Different numerical ranges on the AQI scale correspond to different levels of air quality, with higher numbers indicating poorer air quality and greater health risks. For example, AQI values below 50 are considered good, while values above 300 are considered hazardous.

Question 37
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Concentration of Formaldehyde in indoor environment can be thousand times higher than outdoor environment.Statement II: Formaldehyde is a known carcinogen.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Formaldehyde is a common indoor air pollutant emitted by various sources such as furniture, paints, adhesives, and building materials. Indoor environments, especially poorly ventilated ones, can trap formaldehyde emissions, leading to higher concentrations compared to outdoor environments where formaldehyde can disperse more easily.

Statement II is also true. Formaldehyde is classified as a known human carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) and other regulatory agencies such as the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Prolonged exposure to high levels of formaldehyde has been linked to an increased risk of certain cancers, particularly nasopharyngeal cancer and leukemia.

Question 38
In water treatment Aeration is the process which(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Removes excess and objectionable gases
  • B.Readjusts the pH of water
  • C.Removes the large particles offlocfrom water
  • D.Removes the solid particles
Correct Answer: Removes excess and objectionable gases

Option A is correct.

Aeration is a water treatment process that involves the introduction of air into water. This process serves multiple purposes, but its primary function is to remove excess and objectionable gases from the water.

Aeration introduces oxygen into the water. This is particularly important for bodies of water that have become depleted of oxygen due to various factors such as pollution, organic matter decomposition, or algal blooms. Oxygenation helps sustain aquatic life by replenishing dissolved oxygen levels, which are vital for fish and other organisms.

Aeration can also help remove other gases that may be present in the water, such as carbon dioxide, methane, hydrogen sulfide, or volatile organic compounds (VOCs). These gases can be undesirable or even harmful if present in high concentrations, so aeration helps to vent them out of the water.

Aeration can also help improve the taste and odor of water by releasing volatile compounds that contribute to unpleasant tastes or smells.

Question 39
Which of the following are classified as hazardous substances? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Activated substancesB. Ignitable substancesC. Corrosive substancesD. Reactive substancesE. Toxic substancesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D only
  • B.B, C, D, E only
  • C.A, C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, D, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D, E only

Option B is correct.

Activated substances are not classified as hazardous substances. This term might refer to substances that have been activated or treated for a specific purpose, but it does not inherently indicate that they are hazardous.

Ignitable substances are substances that can catch fire easily. These include flammable liquids, gases, and solids. Ignitable substances are indeed classified as hazardous because they pose fire hazards and can cause accidents or environmental damage if not handled properly.

Corrosive substances are those that can cause damage to living tissues or other materials upon contact. Examples include strong acids and bases. Corrosive substances are classified as hazardous due to their ability to cause burns or corrosion to skin, eyes, or other surfaces.

Reactive substances are those that can undergo vigorous chemical reactions, potentially resulting in the release of heat, gas, or hazardous byproducts. Examples include reactive metals and unstable compounds. Reactive substances are classified as hazardous due to the risks associated with their reactivity, which can lead to accidents or environmental hazards.

Toxic substances are those that can cause harm or illness to living organisms when exposed to them. Examples include poisonous chemicals, heavy metals, and pesticides. Toxic substances are classified as hazardous due to their potential to cause acute or chronic health effects, depending on the level and duration of exposure.

Question 40
What is the limit of water availability for a region to be classified as water-stressed region?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Less than 1700m3/ person/year
  • B.Less than 2000m3/ person/year
  • C.Less than 2300m3/ person/year
  • D.Less than 2500m3/ person/year
Correct Answer: Less than 1700m3/ person/year

Option A is correct.

Water stress refers to a situation where the demand for water exceeds the available supply or when the available water resources are insufficient to meet the needs of a region's population and ecosystems. The threshold for classifying a region as water-stressed varies, but commonly, it is defined based on the amount of water available per person per year.

When the amount of water available per person per year falls below a certain threshold, it indicates water stress. Different organizations and researchers may use slightly different thresholds, but a commonly accepted threshold is less than 1700 cubic meters (m^3) of water per person per year.

Question 41
Among the following skills, which are considered as soft skills?A. Decision makingB. MarketingC. CommunicationD. Conflict resolutionE. LeadershipChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B & E only
  • B.A, C & E only
  • C.A, C, D & E only
  • D.B & D only
Correct Answer: A, C, D & E only

Soft skills are non-technical skills that relate to how you work with others, communicate, and solve problems. Let us consider each option one by one.

A. Decision making - This is a soft skill as it involves analyzing information and making choices.

B. Marketing - While marketing involves various skills, including communication and persuasion, it's more technical and specialized, so it's not typically categorized as a soft skill.

C. Communication - This is a classic soft skill as it involves conveying information effectively.

D. Conflict resolution - This is also a soft skill as it involves resolving disagreements or conflicts.

E. Leadership - Leadership involves guiding and motivating others, making it a soft skill.

Question 42
Which of the following recommendations of the NEP 2020 for improving the quality of higher education in India? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)A. Introduction of National Research FoundationB. Accreditation of all higher education institutionsC. Integration of vocational education into mainstream educationD. Establishment of National higher education Qualification FrameworkChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A & B only
  • B.C & D only
  • C.A, B & D only
  • D.A, B, C & D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C & D only

Following are the key features of NEP 2020 with respect to Higher Education:

Gross Enrolment Ratio in higher education to be raised to 50% by 2035. Also, 3.5 crore seats to be added in higher education. The current Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in higher education is 26.3%.

Holistic Undergraduate education with a flexible curriculum can be of 3 or 4 years with multiple exit options and appropriate certification within this period.

M. Phil courses will be discontinued and all the courses at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD level will now be interdisciplinary.

Academic Bank of Credits to be established to facilitate Transfer of Credits.

Multidisciplinary Education and Research Universities (MERUs), at par with IITs, IIMs, to be set up as models of best multidisciplinary education of global standards in the country.

The National Research Foundation will be created as an apex body for fostering a strong research culture and building research capacity across higher education.

Higher Education Commission of India (HECI) will be set up as a single umbrella body for the entire higher education, excluding medical and legal education. Public and private higher education institutions will be governed by the same set of norms for regulation, accreditation and academic standards. Also, HECI will be having 4 independent verticals namely,

National Higher Education Regulatory Council (NHERC) for regulation,

General Education Council (GEC) for standard setting,

Higher Education Grants Council (HEGC) for funding,

National Accreditation Council (NAC) for accreditation.

The fourth vertical of HECI, i.e., the General Education Council (GEC), will frame expected learning outcomes for higher education programmes, also referred to as ‘graduate attributes’. A National Higher Education Qualification Framework (NHEQF) will be formulated by the GEC and it shall be in sync with the National Skills Qualifications Framework (NSQF) to ease the integration of vocational education into higher education.

Affiliation of colleges is to be phased out in 15 years and a stage-wise mechanism to be established for granting graded autonomy to colleges. Over a period of time, every college is expected to develop into either an autonomous degree-granting College, or a constituent college of a university.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 43
UGC was established on the recommendation of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.University Education Commission
  • B.Higher Education Commission
  • C.Ministry of Education
  • D.Planning Commission
Correct Answer: University Education Commission

The University Education Commission was set up in 1948 under the Chairmanship of Dr. S Radhakrishnan “to report on Indian university education and suggest improvements and extensions that might be desirable to suit the present and future needs and aspirations of the country.” Consequently, the University Grants Commission (UGC) was formally inaugurated by late Shri Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, the then Minister of Education, Natural Resources and Scientific Research on 28 December 1953. It became a statutory body of the Government of India by an Act of Parliament in 1956.

Question 44
Which of the following is incorrect in the light of the effects of the expansion of higher education from themid 1850s.A. Curzon’s universities reform were a high point in the development of the official attitude towards the spread of higher education.B. The attempts were part of a wider programmes of reforming Indian society and purging out of evils such as sati etc.C. Two universities in Calcutta and Madras were established in 1857 and colleges became an integrate part of higher education.D. Only those students were admitted to the college who had passed the entrance.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B
  • B.B & C
  • C.C & D
  • D.B & D
Correct Answer: C & D

Curzon's university reforms were a high point in the devclopment of the official attitude towards the spread of higher education which had been developing since the mid-1850s. It took place against the historical backdrop of the efforts made by English officials to spread Western higher education in the first half of the nineteenth century. The attempts were part of the wider programme of reforming Indian society and purging it of evils such as sati, infanticide, purdah and polygamy, and of bringing Indian and English officials closer together.

 

Therefore, statement A and B are correct.

 

Numerous colleges imparted Western education in the main urban centers of British India. Many of them, like the Hindu College established in 1817 (which became Presidency College in 1853 when Dalhousie reformed it), evolved from schools teaching the alphabet along with subjects like Shakespeare, mathematics, and history. The number of students attending these colleges was not large; they could easily be absorbed into the service of the East India Company and other British institutions. They were active and eager participants in the British administration, stimulating the demand for higher education in Bombay, Calcutta, and Madras. This led E. J. Mouat, secretary of the council of education in Bengal, to submit a plan for university education in India in 1845. The Indians who demanded the provision of such education the most formed the nucleus of the Indian middle classes. They admired, rather than criticized, British administration because of the benefits they derived from it. When the revolt of 1857 broke out, they remained silent spectators. They had actually become the class envisioned by Macaulay in 1835: 'a class of persons Indian in blood and color, but English in taste, opinions, morals, and intellect.' This situation changed in the second half of the mid-1850s. The starting point of the change may be regarded as the establishment of the three universities in Calcutta, Bombay, and Madras in 1857. Henceforth, colleges became an integral part of India's higher educational system. They admitted students who had passed the entrance or matriculation examinations conducted by the universities to which the colleges were affiliated, and they offered instruction only in such courses as had been prescribed by the universities.

 

Therefore, statement C and D are incorrect.

Question 45
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: In the Vedic age both men and women had access to education.Statement II- WoodsDespatch(1854) recognized for the first time that the government should give ‘frank and cordial’ support to female education.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

During the Vedic age, the women enjoyed equal educational right. During the post vedic period, they were deprived of social and religious rites. Therefore, statement I is correct.

 

The wood’s dispatch of 1854 recognised for the first time that the government should give frank and cordial support to female education and take effective measures for the expansion of it.In Wood’s Dispatch, much emphasis was given upon women education. The Dispatch recommended that the education ladder would be incomplete without women education. The Dispatch also encouraged the private enterprises to promote women education. The schools for girls were to be included among those to which grants-in-aid would be given. Thus, statement II is also correct.

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows:Violence against women comes in many forms and from various sources. One that is not highlighted enough is the violence they face from their birth family or natal kin- parents, siblings or close relatives. New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO) ShaktiShalinirecently brought out an incisive report,UnKahi- the Unspoken, documenting the rise of violence against women from natal families during the pandemic.Normally, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help, but during the pandemic, staying at home did not always mean staying safe for many women. A woman complaining about violence from a partner is more easily believable than one who makes such an allegations against her family conditioned as we are to the concept that elders and immediate kin offer protection and physical emotional safety. So, to name and shame them is not easy.ShaktiShalini’sstudy was based on women who approached the NGO for help during the pandemic and encompassed those between 18 and 27 years, with 65% of them belonging to the 22-27 age group. A majority of these women belong to the working and lower middle classes.Media reports during the pandemic highlighted the increase in the incidence of martial violence, but single women living with their families had similar experiences. The honorary secretary of ShaktiShalini, says, “Natal family violence is a phenomenon which is structurally based in our society and therefore needs a structural approach. Though our society lays a claim on the integrity of ‘family as a cohesive unit’, it equally needs to accepted that family is much an environment of abuse of its vulnerable members especially girls and women.The women spoke of abusive and coercive behavior from their natal families and all of them reported emotional abuse and psychological trauma. 15 out 20 women in the study faced physical and verbal violence that included being slapped. Three women reported physical abuse while one was threatened with forced marriage. In terms of the identity of a person who caused harm, in 60% of the cases, it was both male and female relatives.In the passage ‘natal kin’ refers toA. StrangerB. ParentsC. NeighborsD. Close relativesE. Brother and sisterChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B & D only
  • B.C, D & E only
  • C.B, D & E only
  • D.A, B & E only
Correct Answer: B, D & E only

In the passage, 'natal kin' refers to, parents, close relatives and brother and sister.

 

These options correctly represent individuals who are typically considered part of one's natal kin. So, option (C) i.e., B, D & E only is the correct answer.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows:Violence against women comes in many forms and from various sources. One that is not highlighted enough is the violence they face from their birth family or natal kin- parents, siblings or close relatives. New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO) ShaktiShalinirecently brought out an incisive report,UnKahi- the Unspoken, documenting the rise of violence against women from natal families during the pandemic.Normally, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help, but during the pandemic, staying at home did not always mean staying safe for many women. A woman complaining about violence from a partner is more easily believable than one who makes such an allegations against her family conditioned as we are to the concept that elders and immediate kin offer protection and physical emotional safety. So, to name and shame them is not easy.ShaktiShalini’sstudy was based on women who approached the NGO for help during the pandemic and encompassed those between 18 and 27 years, with 65% of them belonging to the 22-27 age group. A majority of these women belong to the working and lower middle classes.Media reports during the pandemic highlighted the increase in the incidence of martial violence, but single women living with their families had similar experiences. The honorary secretary of ShaktiShalini, says, “Natal family violence is a phenomenon which is structurally based in our society and therefore needs a structural approach. Though our society lays a claim on the integrity of ‘family as a cohesive unit’, it equally needs to accepted that family is much an environment of abuse of its vulnerable members especially girls and women.The women spoke of abusive and coercive behavior from their natal families and all of them reported emotional abuse and psychological trauma. 15 out 20 women in the study faced physical and verbal violence that included being slapped. Three women reported physical abuse while one was threatened with forced marriage. In terms of the identity of a person who caused harm, in 60% of the cases, it was both male and female relatives.ShaktiShaliniis (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.a government organization
  • B.A trust
  • C.A research institute
  • D.A non-governmental organization
Correct Answer: A non-governmental organization

The passage mentions Shakti Shalini as a New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO). Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer.

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows:Violence against women comes in many forms and from various sources. One that is not highlighted enough is the violence they face from their birth family or natal kin- parents, siblings or close relatives. New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO) ShaktiShalinirecently brought out an incisive report,UnKahi- the Unspoken, documenting the rise of violence against women from natal families during the pandemic.Normally, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help, but during the pandemic, staying at home did not always mean staying safe for many women. A woman complaining about violence from a partner is more easily believable than one who makes such an allegations against her family conditioned as we are to the concept that elders and immediate kin offer protection and physical emotional safety. So, to name and shame them is not easy.ShaktiShalini’sstudy was based on women who approached the NGO for help during the pandemic and encompassed those between 18 and 27 years, with 65% of them belonging to the 22-27 age group. A majority of these women belong to the working and lower middle classes.Media reports during the pandemic highlighted the increase in the incidence of martial violence, but single women living with their families had similar experiences. The honorary secretary of ShaktiShalini, says, “Natal family violence is a phenomenon which is structurally based in our society and therefore needs a structural approach. Though our society lays a claim on the integrity of ‘family as a cohesive unit’, it equally needs to accepted that family is much an environment of abuse of its vulnerable members especially girls and women.The women spoke of abusive and coercive behavior from their natal families and all of them reported emotional abuse and psychological trauma. 15 out 20 women in the study faced physical and verbal violence that included being slapped. Three women reported physical abuse while one was threatened with forced marriage. In terms of the identity of a person who caused harm, in 60% of the cases, it was both male and female relatives.All statements related to ShaktiShalinistudy are true except (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.it was based on violence against women from natal families during the pandemic
  • B.it was the result of women approaching ShaktiShalinifor help
  • C.it concluded that 75% of women faced physical and verbal violence
  • D.it found that person responsible for violence were only men
Correct Answer: it found that person responsible for violence were only men

In the passage, it's mentioned that in 60% of the cases, both male and female relatives were responsible for the violence. Therefore, the statement claiming that only men were responsible for the violence is incorrect.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows:Violence against women comes in many forms and from various sources. One that is not highlighted enough is the violence they face from their birth family or natal kin- parents, siblings or close relatives. New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO) ShaktiShalinirecently brought out an incisive report,UnKahi- the Unspoken, documenting the rise of violence against women from natal families during the pandemic.Normally, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help, but during the pandemic, staying at home did not always mean staying safe for many women. A woman complaining about violence from a partner is more easily believable than one who makes such an allegations against her family conditioned as we are to the concept that elders and immediate kin offer protection and physical emotional safety. So, to name and shame them is not easy.ShaktiShalini’sstudy was based on women who approached the NGO for help during the pandemic and encompassed those between 18 and 27 years, with 65% of them belonging to the 22-27 age group. A majority of these women belong to the working and lower middle classes.Media reports during the pandemic highlighted the increase in the incidence of martial violence, but single women living with their families had similar experiences. The honorary secretary of ShaktiShalini, says, “Natal family violence is a phenomenon which is structurally based in our society and therefore needs a structural approach. Though our society lays a claim on the integrity of ‘family as a cohesive unit’, it equally needs to accepted that family is much an environment of abuse of its vulnerable members especially girls and women.The women spoke of abusive and coercive behavior from their natal families and all of them reported emotional abuse and psychological trauma. 15 out 20 women in the study faced physical and verbal violence that included being slapped. Three women reported physical abuse while one was threatened with forced marriage. In terms of the identity of a person who caused harm, in 60% of the cases, it was both male and female relatives.Given below are two statements:Statement I: The majority of women in ShaktiShalinistudy belonged to the working and lower middle classes.Statement II: Women are protected in their natal families.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Statement I: The majority of women in Shakti Shalini's study belonged to the working and lower middle classes. This statement is true according to the passage, which mentions that a majority of the women studied belonged to the working and lower middle classes.

Statement II: Women are protected in their natal families. This statement is false based on the passage. The passage highlights the rise of violence against women from their natal families, indicating that women may not always be protected within their familial environment.

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C) i.e., Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the questions that follows:Violence against women comes in many forms and from various sources. One that is not highlighted enough is the violence they face from their birth family or natal kin- parents, siblings or close relatives. New Delhi-based non-governmental organization (NGO) ShaktiShalinirecently brought out an incisive report,UnKahi- the Unspoken, documenting the rise of violence against women from natal families during the pandemic.Normally, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help, but during the pandemic, staying at home did not always mean staying safe for many women. A woman complaining about violence from a partner is more easily believable than one who makes such an allegations against her family conditioned as we are to the concept that elders and immediate kin offer protection and physical emotional safety. So, to name and shame them is not easy.ShaktiShalini’sstudy was based on women who approached the NGO for help during the pandemic and encompassed those between 18 and 27 years, with 65% of them belonging to the 22-27 age group. A majority of these women belong to the working and lower middle classes.Media reports during the pandemic highlighted the increase in the incidence of martial violence, but single women living with their families had similar experiences. The honorary secretary of ShaktiShalini, says, “Natal family violence is a phenomenon which is structurally based in our society and therefore needs a structural approach. Though our society lays a claim on the integrity of ‘family as a cohesive unit’, it equally needs to accepted that family is much an environment of abuse of its vulnerable members especially girls and women.The women spoke of abusive and coercive behavior from their natal families and all of them reported emotional abuse and psychological trauma. 15 out 20 women in the study faced physical and verbal violence that included being slapped. Three women reported physical abuse while one was threatened with forced marriage. In terms of the identity of a person who caused harm, in 60% of the cases, it was both male and female relatives.Natal family violence is difficult to believe in becauseA. The family is seen as a cohesive unitB. Women turn to the natal family for helpC. It is believed that elders and kin offer emotional and physical safetyD. Naming and shaming the natal family is easyE. Women in the family support themChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, D & E only
  • B.B & C only
  • C.A, B & C only
  • D.B, D & E only
Correct Answer: A, B & C only

In the passage, it's mentioned that violence from the natal family is difficult to believe in because the family is seen as a cohesive unit, the natal family is the one a woman turns to for help and there is a belief that elders and kin offer emotional and physical safety.

Quiz Attempt #119746

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the number of males (M) and females (F) (in thousands) in Towns X and Y during the five years from 2018 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions 1-5Year wise numbers of Males and Females in two Towns (in thousands)YearTown XTown YNumber of malesNumber of femalesNumber of malesNumber of females201850495350201952495452202055525554202153535856202255526255Question: What is the ratio of the average number of males in Town X to the average number of males in Town Y for the given period?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.269:282
  • B.265:281
  • C.265:283
  • D.265:282
Correct Answer: 265:282

Required ratio = 50+52+55+53+55553+54+55+58+625 = 5356.4 = 265:282

Question 2
The following table shows the number of males (M) and females (F) (in thousands) in Towns X and Y during the five years from 2018 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions 1-5Year wise numbers of Males and Females in two Towns (in thousands)YearTown XTown YNumber of malesNumber of femalesNumber of malesNumber of females201850495350201952495452202055525554202153535856202255526255Question: For Town Y, the percentage increase in the number of females for a given year with reference to the previous year is maximum in the year __________________(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.2022
  • B.2021
  • C.2020
  • D.2019
Correct Answer: 2019

Percentage increase in

2019 : 52-5050 × 100 = 4%

2020 : 54-5252 × 100 = 3.84%

2021 : 56-5454 × 100 = 3.7%

2022 : There is decrease in 2022.

Thus, percentage increase in women was maximum in 2019.

Question 3
The following table shows the number of males (M) and females (F) (in thousands) in Towns X and Y during the five years from 2018 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions 1-5Year wise numbers of Males and Females in two Towns (in thousands)YearTown XTown YNumber of malesNumber of femalesNumber of malesNumber of females201850495350201952495452202055525554202153535856202255526255Question: The population of Town X in 2018 and 2019 together approximately ______ % of the population of Town Y in 2021 and 2022 together?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.86.6
  • B.89.6
  • C.81.6
  • D.84.5
Correct Answer: 86.6

Required percentage = 50+49+52+4958+56+62+55 × 100 = 86.6%

Question 4
The following table shows the number of males (M) and females (F) (in thousands) in Towns X and Y during the five years from 2018 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions 1-5Year wise numbers of Males and Females in two Towns (in thousands)YearTown XTown YNumber of malesNumber of femalesNumber of malesNumber of females201850495350201952495452202055525554202153535856202255526255Question: Find the number of years in which the number of females in Town X and Y is less than their respective average numbers in these two towns.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.One, two
  • B.Two, two
  • C.Three, two
  • D.Two, one
Correct Answer: Two, two

Average number of females in town X = 49+49+52+53+525 = 51

Average number of females in town Y = 50+52+54+56+555 = 53.5

It is clear that in both the towns X and Y, the number of females were less than their average number during two years.

Question 5
The following table shows the number of males (M) and females (F) (in thousands) in Towns X and Y during the five years from 2018 to 2022. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions 1-5Year wise numbers of Males and Females in two Towns (in thousands)YearTown XTown YNumber of malesNumber of femalesNumber of malesNumber of females201850495350201952495452202055525554202153535856202255526255Question: In which of the following pairs of years, the difference in the number of males and females is maximum for Town Y and minimum for Town X respectively?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.2018 and 2021
  • B.2022 and 2018
  • C.2022 and 2021
  • D.2020 and 2022
Correct Answer: 2022 and 2021

In year 2022 and 2021, the difference in the number of males and females is maximum for town Y and minimum for town X respectively.

Question 6
Which of the following is a major advantage of online learning over offline learning?(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Limited access
  • B.Flexibility
  • C.High cost
  • D.Inter-activity
Correct Answer: Flexibility

The major advantage of online learning over offline learning is typically its flexibility. Online learning allows students to access course materials and participate in classes at their own pace and convenience, which is often not possible in traditional offline learning settings.

Question 7
Which of the following are the benefits of collaborative learning environment?A. Improved communication skillsB. Decreased understanding of different perspectiveC. More opportunities for personal feedbackD. Enhanced problem-solving abilitiesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.B, C & D only
  • B.A & E only
  • C.A, C, & D only
  • D.A, B & D only
Correct Answer: A, C, & D only

The benefits of a collaborative learning environment include improved communication skills, more opportunities for personal feedback, and enhanced problem-solving abilities. Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 8
Which of the following are the basic requirements of effective teaching?A. Teaching only what is included in the curriculumB. Good communication skillsC. Using a rigid teaching approachD. Excellent teaching knowledgeE. Ability to connect with studentsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & C only
  • B.C & E only
  • C.B, D & E only
  • D.A, C & D only
Correct Answer: B, D & E only

The basic requirements of effective teaching typically include good communication skills, excellent teaching knowledge, and the ability to connect with students. Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 9
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) has been adopted only in the central universities of India.Statement II: Choice Based Credit System (CBCS assigns credits based on the learning outcomes of a course.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Statement I is false because CBCS has been implemented in various universities across India, including both central and state universities.

Statement II is true because the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) assigns credits based on the learning outcomes of a course. This means that the credits awarded for a particular course are determined by the objectives and outcomes of that course, which helps in assessing the student's performance and progress effectively.

Question 10
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Moodle is an example of a Learning Management System (LMS)Statement II:Mentimeteris a tool used for creating online surveysIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Statement I: Moodle is an example of a Learning Management System (LMS). Moodle is a widely used open-source platform for creating and managing online courses and educational content.

Statement II: Mentimeter is a tool used for creating online surveys. It allows users to create interactive presentations and polls, making it useful for gathering feedback and engaging audiences during presentations or lectures.

Question 11
Arrange the following steps involved in a research process in correct orderA. Collecting the dataB. Reviewing the literatureC. Reporting the research outcomeD. Identifying a research problemE. Analyzing and interpreting the dataChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, D, B, E, C
  • B.D, A, B, C, E
  • C.B, D, A, E, C
  • D.D, B, A, E, C
Correct Answer: D, B, A, E, C

The correct order of the steps involved in a research process is:

(i) Identifying a research problem (D)

(ii) Reviewing the literature (B)

(iii) Collecting the data (A)

(iv) Analyzing and interpreting the data (E)

(v) Reporting the research outcome (C)

So, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 12
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion A and other is labelled as Reason RAssertion A: Experimental research allows you to eliminate the influence of many extraneous factors.Reason R: In experimental research variables are actively manipulated and environment is as controlled as possibleIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are true and R is not the correct explanation of A
  • C.A is true but R is false
  • D.A is false but R is true
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A

Option A is correct.

Assertion A is true. In experimental research, variables are actively manipulated by the researcher, and the environment is controlled as much as possible. By controlling variables and environmental conditions, researchers can isolate the effects of the independent variable(s) on the dependent variable, thus reducing the influence of extraneous factors.

Reason R is also true and provides a valid explanation for Assertion A. The reason explains why experimental research enables the elimination of many extraneous factors. By actively manipulating variables and controlling the environment, researchers can create controlled conditions to study the effects of specific variables on the outcomes of interest.

Question 13
The property of data such that research results apply to situation beyond the particular sample of individuals/items observed in a single research setting refers to(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Internal validity
  • B.Convergent Validity
  • C.Divergent Validity
  • D.External Validity
Correct Answer: External Validity

Option D is correct.

External validity refers to the extent to which the findings of a study can be generalized or applied to situations, populations, or contexts beyond the specific sample of individuals or items observed in a single research setting. It assesses the generalizability of research results to broader populations or real-world situations.

When research results exhibit external validity, it means that they are applicable beyond the specific conditions of the study, providing insights and implications for broader contexts. This is crucial for ensuring that research findings have relevance and practical utility beyond the immediate study setting.

Internal validity refers to the extent to which a study accurately measures or demonstrates what it intends to measure, without the influence of confounding variables or biases within the study itself.

Convergent validity and divergent validity are related to the construct validity of a measurement instrument. Convergent validity refers to the degree to which different measures of the same construct are correlated, while divergent validity refers to the degree to which measures of different constructs are not correlated.

Question 14
Given below are two statements:Statement I: The purpose of a blind study is to prevent the participants from figuring out what the experimental wantsStatement II: Interaction between the experimenter and the participants is always beneficial in social science researchIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

Option C is correct.

Statement I is true. In a blind study, participants are unaware of certain key aspects of the study, such as which group they belong to (e.g., experimental group or control group) or what the hypothesis of the study is. This is done to prevent participants from being influenced by their knowledge of the experimental conditions, which could introduce bias into the results.

Statement II is false. While interaction between the experimenter and participants can often be beneficial in social science research for various reasons such as building rapport, clarifying instructions, or gathering richer qualitative data, it is not always beneficial. In some cases, excessive interaction or leading questioning by the experimenter could introduce bias or influence participants' responses, thus compromising the validity of the research findings.

Question 15
A researcher computer sample correlationcoefficientsr1,r2,r3andr4from four different samples and obtains their p-values 0.99, 0.999, 0.05 and 0.005 respectively. Correlation coefficientsignificant at 1% level is (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.r1
  • B.r2
  • C.r3
  • D.r4
Correct Answer: r4

Option D is correct.

Question 16
Vladimir Zworykin was associated with the invention of(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Color printing
  • B.Radio
  • C.Television
  • D.Internet
Correct Answer: Television

Vladimir Zworykin was associated with the invention of television.

Question 17
Feedback is immediate in _________ communication(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Print
  • B.Broadcast
  • C.Top- down
  • D.Face-to-face
Correct Answer: Face-to-face

Feedback is immediate in face-to-face communication.

Question 18
What are the advantages of digital media?”A. Network communication is avoidedB. People can create and distribute media contentC. The end-product can be delivered in real timeD. Reproduction and distribution of information products are less expensiveE. Online political involvement is of no importanceChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

The advantages of digital media include:

 

B. People can create and distribute media content: Digital media allows individuals to create and share various forms of content, such as videos, articles, podcasts, and more. Platforms like social media, blogging sites, and video-sharing platforms enable users to produce and disseminate their own content easily, democratizing the media landscape.

 

C. The end-product can be delivered in real-time: Digital media facilitates the instantaneous delivery of content to audiences. With tools like live streaming, social media updates, and online news platforms, information can be shared as events unfold, providing immediacy and relevance to audiences.

 

D. Reproduction and distribution of information products are less expensive: Digital distribution eliminates many of the costs associated with traditional forms of media distribution, such as printing, shipping, and storage. Additionally, digital media enables content creators to reach global audiences without the need for physical distribution channels, reducing costs significantly.

 

Thus, correct answer is option (B).

Question 19
Which of the following factors affect mediated persuasion?A. Extended media reachB. Round-the-clock communicationC. Media differencesD. Audience fragmentationE. Message characteristicsChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.C, D, E only
  • D.A, B, E only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

A widely used model based on certain assertions is called AIDA —attention / awareness, interest, desire and action. From the viewpoint of an advertiser, it is a hierarchical step—down process. The first level is drawing attention or creating awareness which should lead to next stage of generating interest. Once the attention drawn and interest sustained, the person moves towards the stage of desire for the product or service. From desire, s/he will move to the stage of action.

 

Many factors affect the chain or process of mediated persuasion. A few of these are:

1) Media difference

2) Message features

3) Audience fragmentation, and

4) Individual characteristics.

 

Media Difference factor means features of each medium vary. For instance, if you take print and compare it with electronic media, the differences are visible. Print deals with space and the electronic media with time. The style of presentation differs. Similarly, we speak of interactive and passive media. The qualities of message are its characteristics. For example, the level of complexity, extent of credibility, emotionality, or quality of information supplied make for message qualities. With rapid expansion of media in terms of numbers and interests in recent times made the audience fragment, creating a minuscule audience for each channel or medium. This has happened because of wide variety of media choice. However, this has complicated the job of advertising and public relations professionals, as they cannot easily reach out to large audiences. Individual characteristics and conditions mean the demographic factors like age, gender, nationality or race or ethnicity, geographical location, psychographic factors, perceptions of people, thinking and interventions, media habits shaping public taste, opinion, preference, behaviour and knowledge. As a result, strategic communicators — advertising and PR professionals use all their knowledge and experience to choose media channels to reach specialised or fragmented audiences.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 20
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Propagandistic communication at the National level is supposed to recognize the fact that truth need not separated from falsehoodStatement II:The mediated propaganda process blurs truth and falsehood in order to be persuasiveIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true and Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false and Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false and Statement II is true

Statement I: "Propagandistic communication at the National level is supposed to recognize the fact that truth need not separated from falsehood."

Propaganda often involves spreading information to manipulate beliefs, and it gives a one-sided message, emphasizing certain points while ignoring others. The statement (I) is false because ideally, propagandistic communication should uphold truth and avoid spreading falsehoods.

 

Statement II: "The mediated propaganda process blurs truth and falsehood in order to be persuasive."

This statement is true. The propaganda involves manipulating beliefs and giving a one-sided message, which often blurs the line between truth and falsehood to be persuasive.

 

Note that UGC has given option (A) as answer to this question.

Question 21
What number would replace question mark (?) in the series below? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)1.5, 4, 7.5, 12, 17.5, 24, 31.5, ?
  • A.55.5
  • B.38
  • C.40
  • D.45
Correct Answer: 40

Next term = 31.5 + 8.5 = 40

Question 22
If a man investedRs. 20,000 in some shares in the ratio 2:3:5 which pay dividends of 10%, 30% and 20% respectively, on the investments in that year. Find the total dividend income of the man.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 4200
  • B.Rs. 4500
  • C.Rs. 4800
  • D.Rs. 5000
Correct Answer: Rs. 4200

Total dividend = 20000 ( 210 × 0.1 + 310 × 0.3 + 510 × 0.2)

= Rs. 4200

Question 23
The simple interest on a certain principal amount for 4 years at 10% per annum is half of the compound interest onRs1000 for 2 years at 20% per annum. Find the principal amount.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Rs. 500
  • B.Rs. 450
  • C.Rs. 650
  • D.Rs. 550
Correct Answer: Rs. 550

Compound Interest = 1000 (1.2)2 – 1000 = 440

Now, SI = P×R×T100

or 220 = P×10×4100

or P = 550

Thus, principal = Rs. 550

Question 24
In a certain code language:A. ‘Best way to win’ is written as ‘baumaushausa’B. ‘The way to hell’ is written as ‘taumausahau’C. ‘Win of the day’ is written as ‘shaufautaudau’What is the code for ‘hell’ in this language? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.hau
  • B.mau
  • C.shau
  • D.tau
Correct Answer: hau

From A and B, cod for ‘to’ and ‘win’ = mau and sa

From A and C, code for ‘win’ = shau

From B and C, code for ‘the’ = tau

So, the code for ‘hell’ will be hau.

Question 25
A man travels from his home to his office at a speed of 4 km/h and reaches his office 30 minutes late. If the speed had been 6 km/h, he would have reached office 5 minutes early. Find the distance of his office from home.(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.8.5 km
  • B.7 km
  • C.8 km
  • D.9 km
Correct Answer: 7 km

Let the distance be x

Then, x4 - x6 = 3560

or x = 7

Thus, distance = 7 km

Question 26
Given below are two statements:Statement I:‘The jar does not exist’ in common to all kinds of non-existence.Statement II:‘The jar will exist’ refers to previous non-existence.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true and Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false and Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
