Option A is correct. Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

Question 27
In the light of the nature of the reasoning and argument pick out the incorrect statement (s).A. An invalid argument can have combinations of truth or falsity in the premise of conclusionB. No valid argument can have premises and a false conclusionC. Deductive arguments can be ‘almost valid’D. Valid does not mean trueChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B
  • B.B & C
  • C.C
  • D.D
Correct Answer: C

Deductive arguments are either valid or invalid. They are never almost valid.

Question 28
Identify the fallacy committed in the following arguments: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)‘Capital punishment is morally wrong because it is ethically impermissible to conflict death as punishment for crime’.
  • A.Two wrongs make a right
  • B.Look who is talking
  • C.Begging the question
  • D.Scare tactics
Correct Answer: Begging the question

Begging the question fallacy occurs when the conclusion of the argument is assumed to be true within the premises themselves. The argument doesn't provide any evidence or reasoning to support the claim that capital punishment is morally wrong.

The argument "Capital punishment is morally wrong because it is ethically impermissible to inflict death as punishment for crime" essentially restates the same idea in two different ways. It assumes that inflicting death as punishment is inherently wrong, without offering any justification for that assumption.

Question 29
Match List I with the List II. (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)LIST I (CONCEPT)(a) Argument(b) Strong argument(c) Unsound argument(d) Weak argumentLIST II (DEFINITION)(i) A deductive argument that either is invalid or has at least one false premise.(ii) An inductive argument in which the conclusion does not follow probably from the premises.(iii) An inductive argument in which the conclusion follow probably from the premises.(iv) A set of statements in which a claim (conclusion) is defended with reason (premise).Choose the correct answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • B.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iv), (c)-(iii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iv)
  • D.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii)

The correct answer is option D - (D) (a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i), (d)-(ii).

 

The correct match is given below.

 

(a) Argument: A set of statements in which a claim (conclusion) is defended with reason (premise).

(b) Strong argument: An inductive argument in which the conclusion follows probably from the premises.

(c) Unsound argument: A deductive argument that either is invalid or has at least one false premise.

(d) Weak argument: An inductive argument in which the conclusion does not follow probably from the premises.

Question 30
According toSamkhyaschool of thought a word signifies: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Vyakti
  • B.Akriti
  • C.Jati
  • D.Vyakti-Akriti_Jati
Correct Answer: Vyakti

The correct answer is option (A) – Vyakti.

In the Samkhya school of thought, a word signifies Vyakti, which refers to the specific individuality or particularity of an object or person. According to Samkhya philosophy, words are not simply labels for general categories or concepts. Instead, they represent the unique and distinct characteristics of individual entities.

Question 31
A computer processor will operate fastest when the data that it wants is in the(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Cache memory
  • B.Hard disk
  • C.Optical disk
  • D.Main memory
Correct Answer: Cache memory

Option A is correct.

Cache memory is a type of high-speed volatile memory located directly on the processor chip or very close to it. Its primary purpose is to store frequently accessed data and instructions temporarily, allowing the processor to quickly access them when needed.

When a computer processor needs data, it first checks the cache memory. If the required data is found in the cache memory, the processor can retrieve it quickly, resulting in faster processing speeds. This is because cache memory operates at speeds comparable to the processor itself, offering low latency access to data.

Question 32
What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 85.125? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(1001001.111)
  • B.(1010101.111)
  • C.(1100101.001)
  • D.(1010101.001)
Correct Answer: (1010101.001)

85.125 = (1010101.001)2

Question 33
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Shareware is a software that the users can find out for a trial period only, before being chargedStatement II: Freeware is a software that the users can download free of charge, but they cannot modify the source code in any wayIn the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Shareware is a type of software distribution model where users are allowed to try out the software for a limited trial period (usually for free) before deciding whether to purchase it. After the trial period expires, users are typically required to pay for continued use of the software.

Statement II is also true. Freeware refers to software that is available for download and use free of charge. However, unlike open-source software, users are not granted the rights to modify the source code of freeware. Users are typically allowed to use the software as-is, without making any modifications to the code.

Question 34
Danny is buying a new computer that has an LED display. Which of the following statements about the displays are true?A. It is a flat panel displayB. It creates images using red, green and blue diodesC. It is not very energy efficient and gives off heatD. It can be used in mobile devices such as smartphones and tabletsE. It is always a front-lit displayChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A, B, & D only
  • B.A, C, & E only
  • C.B, D & E only
  • D.A, B, D, & E only
Correct Answer: A, B, & D only

Option A is correct.

LED displays are flat panel displays. They are commonly used in various devices, including computer monitors, televisions, and smartphones, due to their slim and lightweight design.

LED displays create images using a combination of red, green, and blue light-emitting diodes (LEDs). By varying the intensity of these diodes, LED displays can produce a wide range of colors, making them versatile for displaying images and videos.

LED displays are commonly used in mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets due to their compact size, low power consumption, and ability to produce bright and vibrant images.

Question 35
Match LIST I with the LIST IILIST I (Data transmission modes in computer network)(a) Simplex(b) Duplex(c) Half-duplexLIST II (Description)(i) Data can be sent and receives at the same time(ii) Data can only be sent or receives(iii) Data can be sent and received but not at same timeChoose the correct answer from the following options: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii)
  • C.(a)-ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii)

Option D is correct.

Simplex, Duplex, and Half-duplex are different data transmission modes in computer networks, each with its own characteristics.

In simplex mode, data can only be sent or received but not both simultaneously. It allows communication in only one direction. For example, a keyboard is a simplex device because it can only send data to the computer, but it cannot receive data from the computer.

In duplex mode, data can be sent and received at the same time. It allows for bidirectional communication, meaning data can flow in both directions simultaneously. For example, in a telephone conversation, both parties can talk and listen at the same time, making it a duplex mode of communication.

In half-duplex mode, data can be sent and received, but not at the same time. Communication alternates between transmitting and receiving. For example, a walkie-talkie operates in half-duplex mode, where one party transmits while the other listens, and then they switch roles.

Question 36
Given below are two statements: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)Statement I: Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) are emitted from vehicles.Statement II: Volatile Organic Compounds are emitted from some trees.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) are emitted from various sources, including vehicles. VOCs are produced during the combustion of fossil fuels in vehicle engines, as well as from the evaporation of fuel and other chemicals used in vehicles. These emissions contribute to air pollution and can have adverse effects on human health and the environment.

Statement II is also true. Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) are naturally emitted by some trees and plants as part of their biological processes. These emissions, known as biogenic VOCs, play important roles in plant growth, reproduction, and communication with other organisms. Some examples of trees that emit VOCs include pine trees, eucalyptus trees, and oak trees.

Question 37
Light Water Reactors (LWRs) are nuclear reactors(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Which use heavy water as a coolant
  • B.Which use graphite rod as moderator
  • C.Which use ordinary water as moderator
  • D.Which use steam as moderator
Correct Answer: Which use ordinary water as moderator

Option C is correct.

Light Water Reactors (LWRs) are a type of nuclear reactor that uses ordinary (light) water as both coolant and moderator. In LWRs, water is used to transfer heat produced by nuclear fission reactions in the reactor core to produce steam, which drives turbines to generate electricity. Additionally, the water acts as a moderator, slowing down the speed of neutrons produced during fission reactions, allowing them to cause further fission reactions.

Question 38
Given below are two statements:Statement I:Biomagnificationoccurs when the toxic burden of large number of organisms at higher trophic level.Statement II: The effect of toxins are magnified in the environment through food webs.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

Option D is correct.

Statement I is false. Biomagnification refers to the process by which the concentration of certain substances, such as toxins or pollutants, increases at higher levels of the food chain. However, it is not necessarily about the "toxic burden of a large number of organisms." Instead, it refers to the accumulation of toxins as one moves up the food chain, with organisms at higher trophic levels (such as top predators) often having higher concentrations of these substances due to ingesting prey that have accumulated them.

Statement II is true. Toxins introduced into ecosystems can accumulate and become more concentrated as they move through food webs. This occurs because each successive trophic level ingests a larger number of prey items containing the accumulated toxins from the lower trophic levels. As a result, organisms at higher trophic levels may experience more significant impacts from these toxins due to biomagnification.

Question 39
Given below are two statements:Statement I: Exposure to noise pollution adversely affects the physiological health of a person.Statement II: Exposure to noise pollution adversely affects the psychological health of a person.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. Noise pollution can have various physiological effects on individuals, including hearing impairment, increased blood pressure, elevated stress levels, disturbance of sleep patterns, and even cardiovascular problems. Prolonged exposure to high levels of noise can lead to significant health issues and exacerbate existing health conditions.

Statement II is also true. Noise pollution can have detrimental effects on psychological well-being, including increased levels of stress, anxiety, irritability, and decreased concentration and productivity. Chronic exposure to loud or disturbing noises can lead to mental health issues such as depression and reduced quality of life.

Question 40
Most of the countries in International Solar Alliance lie(UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Above Tropic of Cancer
  • B.Below Tropic of Cancer
  • C.Between Tropic of Cancer and Capricorn
  • D.nthe Southern Hemisphere
Correct Answer: Between Tropic of Cancer and Capricorn

Option C is correct.

The International Solar Alliance (ISA) is an alliance of countries situated between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn. These countries are typically located in the regions closer to the equator. The main objective of the ISA is to promote the use of solar energy and to reduce dependence on fossil fuels for energy generation.

The Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn are imaginary lines located approximately 23.5 degrees north and south of the equator, respectively. The regions between these two tropics receive relatively higher amounts of sunlight throughout the year, making them ideal for harnessing solar energy.

Question 41
Given below are two statements:Statement I: TheUpanayanaceremony which marked the initiation of a child into a study of the Vedas was performed for boys as well as for girls.Statement II: Both boys and girls received education in ‘Asharams’ and ‘Gurukuls’ in ancient India.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

Option A is correct.

Statement I is true. The Upanayana ceremony, also known as the sacred thread ceremony, is a significant rite of passage in Hinduism. Traditionally, it was performed for boys from the upper castes to mark their initiation into the study of the Vedas and to receive education from a guru. However, in some ancient Indian traditions, girls also underwent the Upanayana ceremony and received education in Vedic studies. While the practice may have been less common for girls compared to boys, it did occur in certain regions and communities.

Statement II is also true. In ancient India, education was imparted in Gurukuls (ancient Indian residential schools) and Ashrams (hermitages or monastic communities). Both boys and girls had access to education in these institutions, although the curriculum and methods of instruction may have varied based on gender, caste, and social norms prevalent at the time. Girls received education in various subjects, including scriptures, philosophy, arts, and domestic skills, under the guidance of gurus in Ashrams and Gurukuls.

Question 42
Given below are two statements:Statement I: According to NEP 2020, at present the investment in research and innovation in India is only <1% of GDP.Statement II: NEP 2020 recommends the establishment of a national curriculum framework for Teacher Education.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

According to NEP 2020, despite the critical importance of research, the research and innovation investment in India is, at the current time, only 0.69% of GDP as compared to 2.8% in the United States of America, 4.3% in Israel and 4.2% in South Korea.

Also, NEP 2020 emphasized that by 2021, a new and comprehensive National Curriculum Framework for Teacher Education, NCFTE 2021, would be formulated by the NCTE in consultation with NCERT, based on the principles of NEP 2020.

Therefore, both statement I and II are true.

Question 43
The first Education Commission in India also adhered to (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.The one-language formula
  • B.The two-language formula
  • C.The three-language formula
  • D.The four-language formula
Correct Answer: The three-language formula

The Three Language Formula provides for a study of a modern Indian language, preferably one of the Southern languages, apart from Hindi and English in the Hindi speaking States and of Hindi along with the regional language and English in the non-Hindi speaking States.

The first Education Commission suggested that higher education should be imparted through the regional language with the option to use the federal language (hindi) as the medium of instruction either for some subjects or for all subjects. English Should be studied in the Higher Schools and in the Universities for keeping the students in touch with the living stream of ever-growing knowledge.

Question 44
In the light of the changes included to the existing universities under the Indian Universities Act 1904, which among the following is incorrect?A. An enlargement of the functions of the universitiesB. The introduction of the new principle of election to the senateC. Easier conditions for affiliation of colleges to universitiesD. Definition of the territorial units of the universitiesE. Increase the size of the universities senateChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B
  • B.A & D
  • C.B & D
  • D.C & E
Correct Answer: C & E

The proposed modifications under the Indian Universities Act of 1904 included the following key points:

The Act restructured the administrative bodies of the universities, setting the membership of the Senates at Calcutta, Madras, and Bombay Universities to between 50 and 100 members, and for Punjab and Allahabad Universities, between 40 and 75 members.

It determined that each of the three larger universities would elect 20 fellows (members), while the other two would elect 15 fellows. The remaining members were to be appointed by the Chancellor for a period of five years.

The legislation expanded the government's control over the universities, granting it the authority to veto decisions made by the Senate and Syndicates.

It tasked the Senates with overseeing examinations, curriculum, various departments, and the Quality Assessment of the universities.

Syndicates were officially recognized and were ensured adequate representation of university faculty.

The Act specified strict conditions for university affiliation, which were expected to be strictly enforced.

The government was allocated specific powers concerning the regulations established by the Senates.

The Viceroy received the authority to determine the geographical boundaries of the universities.

Universities were endowed with the responsibility to facilitate student instruction by hiring professors and lecturers and were encouraged to perform all activities that would support the advancement of study and research.

Question 45
Given below are two statements in the context of NEP 2020:Statement I: High performing Indian Universities will be encouraged to set up companies in other countries.Statement II: Selected universities from among the top 500 universities in the world will be facilitated to operate in India.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Both Statement I and Statement II are true
  • B.Both Statement I and Statement II are false
  • C.Statement I is true but Statement II is false
  • D.Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Correct Answer: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

According to NEP 2020, High performing Indian universities will be encouraged to set up campuses in other countries, and similarly, selected universities e.g., those from among the top 100 universities in the world will be facilitated to operate in India.

Thus, statement I is true but statement II is false.

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the next five questions. Choose the most appropriate options from the options given:As part of the great cultural renaissance generated during the post-independence period, there has occurred a most meaningful encounter with tradition in various fields of creative activity. The return to and discovery of tradition was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. This was a part of the whole process of decolonization of our lifestyle, values, social institutions, creative forms and cultural modes.The modern Indian theatre, product of a colonial theatrical culture, felt the need to search for roots most intensely to match its violent dislocation from the traditional course. Directors like B.V.Karanth, K.N.PanikkarandRatanThiyamhave had a most meaningful encounter with tradition and, with their work, have reversed the colonial course of contemporary theatre and put it back on the track of the greatNatyashastratradition. It soundsparadoxial, but their theatre is both avant-garde in the context of conventional realistic theatre, and still belongs to theNatyashastratheatrical tradition.Post- Independence cultural renaissance in Indian theatre focused on (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Development of Western theatre
  • B.Return to traditional Western theatre
  • C.Search for traditional Indian theatre
  • D.Modern Western theatre
Correct Answer: Search for traditional Indian theatre

The passage discusses how the post-independence cultural renaissance in Indian theatre led to a renewed focus on tradition. After gaining independence from colonial rule, there was a widespread desire to rediscover and reconnect with India's cultural heritage. This included a concerted effort to revitalize traditional Indian theatre forms that had been marginalized during the colonial period.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the next five questions. Choose the most appropriate options from the options given:As part of the great cultural renaissance generated during the post-independence period, there has occurred a most meaningful encounter with tradition in various fields of creative activity. The return to and discovery of tradition was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. This was a part of the whole process of decolonization of our lifestyle, values, social institutions, creative forms and cultural modes.The modern Indian theatre, product of a colonial theatrical culture, felt the need to search for roots most intensely to match its violent dislocation from the traditional course. Directors like B.V.Karanth, K.N.PanikkarandRatanThiyamhave had a most meaningful encounter with tradition and, with their work, have reversed the colonial course of contemporary theatre and put it back on the track of the greatNatyashastratradition. It soundsparadoxial, but their theatre is both avant-garde in the context of conventional realistic theatre, and still belongs to theNatyashastratheatrical tradition.The return to and discovery of traditional in post-independence era was inspired byA. Search for valuesB. Search for rootsC. Search for realismD. Search for identityChoose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.A & B only
  • B.D & C only
  • C.B, C & D only
  • D.B & D only
Correct Answer: B & D only

According to the given passage, the return to and discovery of tradition in the post-independence era was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the next five questions. Choose the most appropriate options from the options given:As part of the great cultural renaissance generated during the post-independence period, there has occurred a most meaningful encounter with tradition in various fields of creative activity. The return to and discovery of tradition was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. This was a part of the whole process of decolonization of our lifestyle, values, social institutions, creative forms and cultural modes.The modern Indian theatre, product of a colonial theatrical culture, felt the need to search for roots most intensely to match its violent dislocation from the traditional course. Directors like B.V.Karanth, K.N.PanikkarandRatanThiyamhave had a most meaningful encounter with tradition and, with their work, have reversed the colonial course of contemporary theatre and put it back on the track of the greatNatyashastratradition. It soundsparadoxial, but their theatre is both avant-garde in the context of conventional realistic theatre, and still belongs to theNatyashastratheatrical tradition.The most significant contribution of Directors like B.VKaranath, K.NPanikkarandRatanThiyamwas? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.Making Indian theatre totally traditional
  • B.Making Indian theatre backward
  • C.Dislocating Indian theatre from the traditional Indian theatre
  • D.Bringing about an amalgamation for the Indian theatrical tradition with Western realistic theatre
Correct Answer: Bringing about an amalgamation for the Indian theatrical tradition with Western realistic theatre

According to the given passage, the most significant contribution of directors like B.V. Karanth, K.N. Panikkar, and Ratan Thiyam was bringing about an amalgamation of the Indian theatrical tradition with Western realistic theatre.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the next five questions. Choose the most appropriate options from the options given:As part of the great cultural renaissance generated during the post-independence period, there has occurred a most meaningful encounter with tradition in various fields of creative activity. The return to and discovery of tradition was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. This was a part of the whole process of decolonization of our lifestyle, values, social institutions, creative forms and cultural modes.The modern Indian theatre, product of a colonial theatrical culture, felt the need to search for roots most intensely to match its violent dislocation from the traditional course. Directors like B.V.Karanth, K.N.PanikkarandRatanThiyamhave had a most meaningful encounter with tradition and, with their work, have reversed the colonial course of contemporary theatre and put it back on the track of the greatNatyashastratradition. It soundsparadoxial, but their theatre is both avant-garde in the context of conventional realistic theatre, and still belongs to theNatyashastratheatrical tradition.TheNatyashastratradition refers to? (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.The colonial tradition
  • B.Avant-garde theatre
  • C.Conventional realistic theatre
  • D.Indian theatrical tradition
Correct Answer: Indian theatrical tradition

According to the given passage, the Natyashastra tradition refers to Indian theatrical tradition.

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the next five questions. Choose the most appropriate options from the options given:As part of the great cultural renaissance generated during the post-independence period, there has occurred a most meaningful encounter with tradition in various fields of creative activity. The return to and discovery of tradition was inspired by a search for roots and a quest for identity. This was a part of the whole process of decolonization of our lifestyle, values, social institutions, creative forms and cultural modes.The modern Indian theatre, product of a colonial theatrical culture, felt the need to search for roots most intensely to match its violent dislocation from the traditional course. Directors like B.V.Karanth, K.N.PanikkarandRatanThiyamhave had a most meaningful encounter with tradition and, with their work, have reversed the colonial course of contemporary theatre and put it back on the track of the greatNatyashastratradition. It soundsparadoxial, but their theatre is both avant-garde in the context of conventional realistic theatre, and still belongs to theNatyashastratheatrical tradition.Decolonializationis the process of (UGC NET Paper 1 June 2023)
  • A.becoming independent from
  • B.becoming dependent on
  • C.relying on
  • D.learning from
Correct Answer: becoming independent from

Decolonialization is the process of ‘becoming independent from.’
